descriptionPlain:
Netflix is developing the industry’s next generation of Production Finance professionals who will work with the Content and Production teams in Tokyo, Japan. The Junior Executive Training (JET) Program is an entry-level production finance position with rotations through our in-house production headquarters as well as on-set of our original productions. JET Coordinators will support Netflix Production Finance Leadership and Associates and will also experience working on the set of a Netflix production to work as a member of the production accounting team.  JET Coordinators will be working with Content teams especially the Live Action content related teams. 
Exceptional JET Coordinators will have the opportunity to develop into Full-time Production Finance Coordinators. This is a two-year rotational program composed of hands-on work, educational seminars, and mentorship. Our next JET class is scheduled to begin April 2023.

descriptionPlain:
It’s an amazing time to be joining Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment globally. Netflix is the world's leading internet entertainment service with 231 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause and resume watching, as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. 

Netflix is pursuing consumer products because we believe it will drive meaningful show awareness/buzz with more tangible, curated ways to interact with our most popular content and in effect, drive long-term revenue. We want licensed merchandise to help promote our titles and build them into franchises so they become part of the zeitgeist for long periods of time. 

The Opportunity
We are seeking an Administrative Assistant to support our Director of Consumer Products EMEA and the broader Consumer Products and Experiences team.  This role is based in our London office.

The successful candidate will be self-motivated, proactive, quick-thinking, flexible, and able to juggle multiple and diverse responsibilities with unwavering attention to detail at all times. A high level of organization, proactivity and excellent communication skills are a must.  We need someone who can not only be great in their day-to-day work but can identify opportunities to make the overall team more organized and efficient.  Someone who is curious demonstrates significant initiative, and inherently exercises good judgment will be most successful both in the role and at Netflix. Read our culture memo to understand more about how we work.

In April 2022, we announced that we are creating a new lower-priced, ad-supported tier for our customers. We are now working toward our goal of providing more choice for consumers and a premium, better-than-linear TV brand experience for advertisers. That said, we are looking for the founding members of this new business area for Netflix! 

The Ads Data Science and Engineering team at Netflix’s mission is to help build the foundation of the ads business at Netflix. We conduct analyses and develop analytic tools, build predictive models and algorithms using machine learning, all with the goal of creating more choices and joy for our members. As a leader in this space, you’ll work closely with partner teams to think big picture about our business goals and how we achieve them through analysis and experimentation. Your team will apply strong analytical rigor to evaluate ideas, dissect problems, build workflows, provide recommendations and drive success on end-to-end analytics initiatives in this 0 -1 space.

• Monitor, review and analyze global online marketplaces for infringing consumer products, collaborating closely with external vendors and internal stakeholders.
  • Identify high value targets and online trends for further investigation.
  • Field and file takedowns regarding trademarks, and DMCA copyright violations using third party monitoring tools, platform complaint programs or directly via other party’s policies.
  • Authenticate products and coordinate authentication with internal stakeholders as needed.
  • Train customs and law enforcement agencies and respond to seizure notifications and other anti-counterfeiting activities. 
  • Help develop and manage data-driven strategies for brand enforcement, including tracking and reporting.
  • Design, develop, and manage evidence archive and tracking systems.
  • Maintain matter trackers and WebTMS database.

• 3 - 5 years of online marketplace enforcement experience, preferably in the entertainment studio space.
  • Understanding of IP law, including trademark, copyright and fair use principles.
  • Experience identifying and making judgment calls about how to enforce IP rights against a range of infringing and counterfeit goods.
  • Experience using brand protection tools and IP management tools, such as Corsearch, Meta IPR platform, Amazon Brand Registry, and WebTMS.
  • Experience collaborating with a broad set of cross-functional team to achieve business goals, including different legal, business, marketing and PR teams.  
  • Tech­-savviness, including proficiency with systems and tools to manage a high volume of matters (e.g., database, reporting, information management systems).

• High level of organization, detail orientation and ability to time-manage across multiple deadlines.
  • Ability to respond positively to change and be receptive to new ideas.
  • Ability to work effectively and collaboratively cross-functionally, think practically and be solution-oriented.
  • Ability to work across borders with multicultural EQ.

Netflix has entered a completely new phase of its evolution. We are combining the worlds of technology and entertainment, with 200+ million global members and over 1000 original shows and films from around the world. We face the dual challenge of successfully launching an ever-growing multitude of titles, and doing so in a personalized manner for every individual member (both current and future). Our data-driven culture allows us to innovate to provide the best catalog offering for our members to maximize their satisfaction and drive acquisition.
 
The Content Analytics Data Science and Engineering (“DSE”) team is at the forefront of advancing metrics, analytic products, and engineering to improve future TV/Film selection and member outcomes - in close collaboration with business and content leaders, the team is working to revolutionize how we use data to inform and aid strategic business decisions in content prioritization, content portfolio optimization, and measurement. We drive considerable business impact through strong partnerships and relentless commitment to practical analytic innovation, application, and enablement.

While our approaches and impact are industry-leading, we are just scratching the surface given our complex, rapidly evolving industry and the scale of our business. In this role, you will own the strategy, roadmap, and implementation of a self-service analytics platform that will unlock non-technical end user’s ability to obtain and utilize data to inform decision making. 

To achieve this potential, we are looking for a Senior Analytics Engineer who is collaborative and innovative with a strategic mindset, business focus, and deep engineering chops. This experienced individual will partner with other Analytics Engineers, Data Engineers, and our business partners within Content to enable direct access to the insights and information produced by the DSE team. Check out this blog post to get a better feel for what it’s like to be a Senior Analytics Engineer at Netflix.

descriptionPlain:
At Netflix our goal is to entertain the world. Our 200+ million members stream award-winning content, and play thousands of hours of games, from 190 countries. Everything that we build to delight our members, and all of the work we do to figure out how to do that better, relies on our extensive infrastructure, which spans what we rent from AWS (we are AWS’s biggest customer) to what we build ourselves (we operate our own custom-built content delivery network, Open Connect). Because this infrastructure is so central to everything we do, we want to ensure we are using it in the most effective and efficient way. Doing that well starts with great visibility into how we are using our infrastructure, and actionable metrics and analytics to help us take action as needed.

As a Senior Analytics Engineer you will join the team of Analytics Engineers, Data Engineers, and Data Scientists who partner with our infrastructure engineering teams to build tools, create metrics and perform analysis that help us make better decisions about our infrastructure using data. You will work closely with engineering leadership, and our Strategy, Planning & Analysis partners to align on infrastructure analytics strategy, and will then collaborate with Data Engineers and Data Scientists to execute that strategy.

The ideal candidate will excel in data analytics, storytelling with data, cross-functional collaboration, and share a passion for continuously improving the way we use data to make the Netflix infrastructure better.

To learn more about some of the journeys from our team, here's a recommended read for more insight into our culture.

description: The Art Director will be the key partner in the execution of new high-fidelity, groundbreaking mobile games. You will be the motivational foundation of the Art team on the project and will help define the visual direction of the game. Additionally, you will be one of the key communications conduits for design and programming. You will act as both a manager and a mentor, fostering a team culture of collaboration, inclusivity, and empowerment. You will strive to develop processes and solutions that help to support a sustainable work life for your team.

lists.content:
• Direct, lead, and guide multiple art disciplines on a project team through all phases of development
  • Provide art direction and give feedback to team of artists and external vendors
  • Supervise, train, mentor, motivate Artists
  • Coach team members to their optimum performance levels, and ensure the team receives regular reviews and one-on-one meetings
  • Manage performance within the team in a way that encourages autonomy, mastery, and purpose
  • Create visual touchstone assets that inspire and set visual direction and vision for others (concepts, models, paint-overs) • Manage art production and push the visual quality of art assets so they are hitting and surpassing internal quality bars
  • Maintain current and working knowledge on industry/market trends, make recommendations as appropriate
  • Partner with the Studio Art Director to own and define assigned aspects of the project as directed
  • Contribute to developing pipelines for project with specific creative and technological needs in collaboration with engineering
  • Anticipate, identify, and present problem areas and develop preventative solutions for the team
  • Partner with production to ensure schedules and plans meet business and project needs
  • Partner with senior management to ensure team is healthy and strong
  • Work closely with game design to ensure art enhances the player experience
  • Present designs to clients, partners or upper management for approval
  • Exemplify reliability, accountability, and professionalism in all work-related interaction
  • Lead by example, creating a strong sense of purpose and community, promoting a culture of excellence and inclusivity, encouraging a sustainable work/life balance

• A proven ability to visually solve problems in collaboration with the broader game team including other artists, art leads, and design leads
  • Strong foundation in concept art skills, traditional art skills, knowledge in graphic design principles.
  • Strong eye for light, value, composition, color, anatomy.
  • Able to adapt to a great diversity of visual styles whether stylized or realistic.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication. Comfortable interacting and presenting to all levels of the company, key stakeholders, and publishers.
  • Excellent attention to detail and strong desire to iterate and improve on processes
  • Demonstrate fundamentals of leadership, including clear and proactive communication, meeting moderation, and oversight of large cross-disciplinary initiatives
  • Ability to manage multiple, competing tasks and be self-directed to meet deadlines in a quickly evolving environment with little to no supervision
  • Positive attitude and ability to receive and provide objective and constructive feedback
  • Ability to coach, manage, mitigate, and prioritize through stressful situations for you and your team

• 7 years’ experience crafting video game art
  • 3 years’ experience as a lead artist or art director
  • Experience working with an art director to develop a unique and cohesive visual style
• Our core hours are 10am to 6:00pm cst, which means you should be available for meetings etc. during this time.

• Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

descriptionPlain:
We’re looking for a creative and highly-skilled Art Director to help us forge the artistic vision on a brand-new unpublished AAA game. As Art Director, you will define the look of a new game and work on all aspects of art to guide a prototype on the path to production. Most importantly, you will work with a fun, dedicated, and passionate cross-discipline team. The right candidate will bring industry-leading craft expertise and attention to detail to generate conceptual and in-game artwork that is emotionally resonant, iconic, and full of heart.  You are as capable of rolling up your sleeves and getting your hands dirty creating art, as you are defining and carrying the artistic vision for the product and leading your team of artists.  

We're building the foundation for a small, but ambitious team of creators.  We’re looking for that group of key leaders who are aligned with our core values, and care deeply about the experiences they create as well as the people they make them with. Those who bias towards action and are energized by the learning that comes with bold experimentation at an agile pace. As a part of Netflix, we strive to hire the best and value integrity, excellence, respect, inclusion, and collaboration. 

Now is an amazing time to join Netflix as we seek to entertain the world. We have over 200 million paid members in over 190 countries, and we won’t stop there.

lists.content:
• Define the look of the project, unique art style, and key visual differentiation
  • Iterate on the core game concept, bringing to bear visual design and artistic considerations
  • Define the art team structure, identifying roles and responsibilities for sub-disciplines including Animation, Concept Art, Character, Environment and Technical Art
  • Iterate on the full project plan, informing timelines and deliverables through key art milestones
  • Develop milestones for the art team through clear direction and sustainable scoping
  • Define the art content development workflows, partnering with technical resources to enable efficient asset creation pathways
  • Work in lock-step with the rest of the core team leadership (TD/GD/AD/PD) to maintain and achieve the vision of the game
  • Serve as a craft leader and elevate other artists' work to meet the studio quality bar
  • Establish style guides and specs required to define and document the art direction of the project
  • Potentially manage the relationships of any external art contractors
  • Help grow, mentor, and guide the team, including directly managing art team members
  • Develop inspirational concept pieces that convey setting, tone, mood, and feel 
  • Champion and evolve an artistic vision and shared visual language to unify environments, characters, game features, etc. into a cohesive overall experience 
  • Conceptualize in-game ideas quickly throughout early discovery 
  • Craft detailed, easy to interpret concepts that guide 3D artists, and other teammates, towards successful implementation in-game
  • Block-in 3D art during rapid prototyping and pre-production exploration
  • Help solve gameplay, clarity, and aesthetic problems with concept crits and paintovers, visual mockups, and storyboards
  • Create and maintain a world-class team of artists, guiding them towards incredible performance and purposeful growth
  • Work with game designers to understand and fulfill the needs of gameplay
  • Work with engineers to understand constraints and maximize visual quality and fidelity while meeting technical requirements
  • Collaborate with teammates by providing and receiving creative/team feedback, plus’ing others’ creative contributions, and providing clear creative goals with intentionally desired outcomes

• At least 10 years of game art production experience, including experience in an art leadership role 
  • Has shipped multiple games in an art-focused role: concept, character, environment, illustration, world-building, etc.
  • Proven track record of delivering clear and consistent visual feedback that elevates other artists’ work
  • Thrives as a member of a cross-functional multidisciplinary team
  • Communicates with authenticity, intention, and curiosity
  • Gets excited by learning new skills, dashing to pitch in, even if this means flexing beyond this role’s core responsibilities if it can help us win
  • Plays broadly across multiple games of varied genres
  • Works effectively offsite on shared projects
  • Has hands-on experience with shipped titles on Unreal Engine 4; Has been working with the latest release of Unreal Engine 5
  • Has worked extensively in the early  concept and prototyping phase of development
• Los Angeles Preferred (as the product needs demand)

lists.content:
• Support near-term and long-term P&L and cash flow forecasts for Netflix’s content investments in France and Benelux
  • Develop insightful presentations that summarize this data and facilitate decision-making for senior Netflix management and stakeholders
  • Perform financial scenario analysis to support senior management's strategic decision making
  • Forecast programming flow and analytics to plan for long-term content health across regions
  • Manage key title metadata in FP&A forecasting system to ensure forecast accuracy
  • Work closely with the Public Policy team to comply with local AVMS requirements 
  • Working cross-functionally with various teams to support content initiatives.

  • Prior experience in financial planning & analysis / commercial finance is preferred, potentially combined with a management consulting or Big 4 accounting background.

  • The successful candidate must display initiative in anticipating and exceeding the business demands of senior-level business leaders. This person must thrive in a fast-paced environment and exhibit the highest personal and professional standards of integrity and ethics.

  • Lead kick-off and regular production meetings with partner studios and Netflix teams throughout all production phases 
  • Review production reports and troubleshoot any production, schedule and budget issues
  • Review available scripts, designs, storyboards, animatics to meet expected standards 
  • Approve payments and changes in schedule or budget 
  • Be the first point of production contact, the central Netflix communication point for assigned shows and Netflix cross functional teams
  • Initiate creation of stepped development schedules and budgets based on pitch materials,  creative and business expectations and review them in a timely manner
  • Manage stepped development schedules and budgets with creators and various Netflix Teams to suit the needs of assigned projects and report on their status
  • Read and monitor materials and advise on scope of production
  • Spearhead understanding of animation production studio needs
  • Support and guide the animation testing period
  • Support a proper handover/overlap of key information from development to the production teams
  • Liaise with and update to the Netflix Cross Functional teams
  • Provide production management guidance to partner managed productions
  • Review productions through all phases of production and budgets, forecasting, supervising and advising shows to meet agreed creative and business expectations
  • Update Netflix schedules and slate 
  • Introduce and guide crews in working with Netflix informational, security and delivery systems
  • Propose and implement the updating and maintenance of Netflix information sources, new tools and best workflows

  • Ability to prioritize and show flexibility to reprioritize when needed
  • Ability to be articulate, have good written skills and be a clear communicator
  • Strong organization and communication skills
  • Attention to details and discretion with confidential information 
  • Proactive team player and positive problem solver 
  • Proficiency in Google Suite, MS Word, Excel, Final Draft - Shotgrid if possible
  • Able to understand basic photoshop and design tools to manage files

you will lead rigorous analyses on the operational effectiveness of the CP and Dubbing teams, quantifying the impact of strategic initiatives and identifying next frontiers to drive innovation and scale.

descriptionPlain:
Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with 231 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time.

Tudum is Netflix’s official editorial fan destination, where our daily breaking news, original videos, exclusive interviews and behind the scenes storytelling reach millions of Netflix fans every month. We’re only a year old but growing fast. And we’re looking for a highly motivated, creative digital publishing expert to join our “growing” Tudum Growth Team as a Growth Specialist to help fans discover and connect with the Tudum.com brand and its content.

The Tudum Growth team exists to influence how fans discover the site and its storytelling in order to deepen their relationship with the brand. We show up where fans of our titles are, identifying new opportunities, platforms, audiences and tactics that we think will delight, inform and entertain the right fans at the right times. We back up our work with data and continuously evolve so we can do the best work of our lives. The right candidate will be entrepreneurial, unafraid to take creative risks and be as passionate about digital media, storytelling and strategic audience building as we are. 

Supporting the end-to-end audience journey from awareness to conversion, the ideal candidate will be instrumental in building and enhancing audience connection with Tudum storytelling and the Netflix IP that lives there while experimenting with new ways to engage existing and emerging digital communities. You will identify and implement key optimization tactics across multiple touchpoints including, most crucially, Tudum’s owned editorial newsletter products and content distribution levers that support the brand’s overall mission and audience growth strategy.

You’ll play a critical role in executing these newsletter and distribution strategies, working across multiple cross-functional teams to extend the reach and amplification of Tudum storytelling.  This isn’t a traditional social role — though deep knowledge and understanding of the social ecosystem (Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, TikTok) and how it contributes to a holistic audience growth strategy is a must. Your focus will instead largely be on executing distribution initiatives that introduce our content to new readers and build loyalty with existing ones via newsletters, digital partnerships, third-party aggregators and community platforms such as Reddit.

  • Project manage audience development touch points and its associated components, from inception to successful completion.

  • Execute audience development testing strategy -- including funnel optimization and distribution channel mix.
  • Support Tudum tentpole initiatives by executing best-in-class digital rollout strategy, from online partnerships to IRL events.
  • Work across multiple teams within Tudum and the broader Netflix org to get assets, launch dates, and any other information and materials necessary to enact title distribution and email plans.

  • Experience in content distribution channels including but not limited to SEO, partnerships and community platforms such as Reddit and LinkedIn.

  • Respect and enthusiasm for the Netflix brand, its IP and its culture.

  • Highly collaborative — you’re not afraid to lead or follow and believe in the power of “showing” your work.

descriptionPlain:
As Netflix grows, the Audio Visual (AV) Builds team within our Netflix Technology Services (N-Tech) is searching for an inclusive, motivated, knowledgeable leader to join and lead the AV Builds team. The ideal candidate thrives on leading a high-performing team while building strong cross-functional relationships and delivering exceptional and world-class Builds that represent the Netflix brand.

The AV Builds team works to design, build, and support high quality collaborative spaces. These spaces exist across the many domains of Netflix from corporate, animation, and gaming spaces as well as a variety of different venues.

As an AV Builds manager, you will be responsible for maintaining all aspects for the AV Builds team from design/consultation to execution.  This role should focus on hiring and developing the Amers AV Builds team, and helping craft strategies to bring the group to the next level.  You will lead the technical representation for our cross-functional partners and vendors to help, design, manage, and execute Netflix Builds. At Netflix, we are committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion.  We want to share with you that we are mindful of limited access to resources and opportunities that come with systemic disadvantages.  So if you align strongly with our values and have transferable experiences, we encourage you to apply.

We are bringing new stories to millions of people worldwide by promoting our original, exclusive content. Marketing Production (MP) at Netflix is focused on developing and delivering high-impact creative campaigns at speed and scale, to create public joy.

You are an adaptable person who revels in change.

You will serve as the go-to partner and key point-of-contact to all internal stakeholders, facilitating alignment on all AV needs on our Netflix Original and Licensed Title campaigns.

lists.content:

• Communicating with the business to drive the procurement of services from our vendors and understand the status/timeline of delivery of services.

• 5+ years of relevant Finance and/or Accounting experience, preferably in SP&A

  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to navigate large data sets

  • Adaptable - You are comfortable in an ever-changing ecosystem of content, finance and accounting issues and projects
  • Occasional international travel may be required

lists.content:
• Contribute to Netflix’s stated public commitments to halve our greenhouse gas emissions by 2030 and net annual residual emissions to zero starting in 2022, and every year after
  • Work across the entertainment and other industries to further sophisticate and embed carbon accounting and assurance techniques into corporate practice
  • Leverage Netflix’s innovative and fast-paced culture to make impact fast
  • Report to Netflix’s Director of Net Zero + Nature, work in one of the top sustainability teams, and at one of the most-respected companies in the world

• The Manager will oversee calculation of our annual carbon footprint, automation of emissions data collection and analysis, and 3rd party assurance against prevailing standards (i.e. Greenhouse Gas Protocol, Science-Based Target Initiative (SBTi), etc). The Manager will partner closely with the ESG Director for disclosures to investors and governments. These responsibilities include:

• Support Data Analyst in annual footprint data collection and analysis
  • Collection, storage, and management of energy, spend, vendor data from across the company and suppliers.
  • Identification and evaluation of carbon accounting best practices, updated methods, and the latest emission factors from accepted external sources.
  • Quantification and presentation of Netflix’s annual carbon footprint and related analyses to support GHG reductions strategies and stakeholder engagement.
  • Qualify M&A activities to be folded into footprint or may trigger rebaselining
  • Stay apprised with external guidance and industry best practices in boundaries for Scope 3
  • Author the Basis of Reporting document for the footprint and co-author the Basis of Reporting document for emissions reductions

• Continued implementation of enterprise carbon accounting software to automate carbon footprint data collection and analysis.
  • Set-up of software to enable emissions reductions forecasting and tracking.
  • Improvement of methods and processes to streamline the collection, storage, and verification of footprint data.
  • Continually seek ways to improve data structuring and refreshing

• Together with Internal Audit and Finance, continuous improvement of internal processes, controls, and governance related to carbon footprint data.
  • Obtain assurance from 3rd party auditors for the carbon footprint, reductions, and decarbonization roadmap.
  • Ensure alignment with GHG Protocol, SBTi and other relevant accounting and disclosure standards that emerge (e.g. ISO, ISSB)

• With the ESG Director, partner to create accurate, thorough, and consistent disclosures to investors and governments
  • Manage mandatory reporting process with Financial Reporting and Corporate Finance in relevant countries
• Guide cross-company team composed of in-house staff, technical consultants, auditors, and software vendors

• Master’s degree or equivalent practical technical, quantitative, or project experience in the sustainability field.
  • 9+ years practical experience in greenhouse gas accounting, methods, data collection and management, data integrity controls, disclosure and verification. 
  • 5+ years of managerial experience
  • Experience implementing carbon accounting software at a major company
  • Ability to create clear findings from large data sets
  • Demonstrated experience successfully managing fast-paced projects with multiple players across cross-functional teams.
  • Ideally, experience with greenhouse gas accounting software and tools.
  • Familiarity with sustainability-related disclosure standards, data controls, or third-party assurance processes.
  • Strong technical communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to address a wide range of audiences including non-experts in other functions at Netflix.

• Preference for Los Gatos or Los Angeles, California.
  • Majority of team works remotely but largest contingent is based in Los Angeles

descriptionPlain:
At Netflix, we are shaping the future of entertainment because we believe there is a better way to watch. Coupled with our passion for entertainment, the Consumer Insights team helps bring consumer voices into crucial product decisions.

Come join a diverse and collaborative team of Social Scientists, UX/Product and Market Researchers, and Research Operations to bring human perspective and consumer insight to Netflix’s world of entertainment. You’ll work directly with cross functional partners across Netflix, including Data Science, Design and Product. Our primary research ranges from formative to evaluative, and uses approaches such as focus groups, in-depth interviews, usability studies, ethnography, quantitative surveys, as well as statistical modeling.  

The 2023 Consumer Insights Internship will be specifically partnered with our Product Experience Group within CI. This group focuses on uncovering and advocating for current and future Netflix members’ evolving needs. The ideal candidate will have a background in  social science such as anthropology, ethnography, psychology, sociology, behavioral economics, HCI, or UX research. They’ll have interest and some training in using research methods - especially qual and/or quant research - to shape the global product experience and increase member joy.

We’re looking for candidates who are excellent communicators, passionate about product experience, entertainment and tech, eager to engage new audiences, and curious about the complexities of supporting teams that have a global and regional view of future solutions.

• Fundamentals of Accounting- We'd like you to have 3+ years of relevant accounting experience under your belt backed by a bachelor's degree in accounting and/or finance; CPA license is preferred.

  • Enthusiasm and quick learning - Enthusiasm for designing and building new accounting systems and making improvements to existing systems. Prior work with contract review (revenue, leases, or other complex documents), data entry and analysis, research, and other problem-solving tasks is helpful, but we understand you probably have never done content accounting.  That's OK with us because we'll teach you as long as you're excited about learning.

descriptionPlain:
Netflix is the world's leading internet entertainment service with over 222 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments. With this international expansion and a move into Korean originals, it's a great time to join Netflix.

The Opportunity


From “Gritty Crime Thrillers” to “K-dramas for Hopeless Romantics,” the system that powers Netflix’s multitudes of personalized row recommendations is the result of years of painstaking content analysis, intricate taxonomical work, data science, and pure movie and TV geekery.

If you are an avid fan and a serious consumer of visual entertainment, the Editorial Creative team at Netflix is seeking a unique candidate who can capture the essence of Korean movies and TV shows and turn that into data and information. This starts with digging deep into every assigned title, researching, tagging, rating, and enhancing other pieces of metadata that will help connect our members to the content they’ll love. This role also has an integral component that is heavy on cross-functional alignment, including editorial ownership of assigned titles along with domain expertise.

This role will join a team of classification experts: people who can identify, collect and transform the artistic qualities of movies and TV shows into the data that powers personalization for more than 200 million people around the world. This hire innately understands the facets, tropes, and themes that allow audiences around the world to laugh, think, escape, cry, and tell their friends, “You have to watch this.” 

The ideal candidate has a deep and broad knowledge of visual media and is passionate about global entertainment. They can succinctly and broadly communicate what’s important about a piece of content, and why, in Korean and English. They are comfortable working in a high-volume, high-quality, deadline- and data-driven environment. They are an excellent cross-functional partner who can relay the importance of this work to colleagues beyond your team, as well as collaborate on unique projects that use tags, metadata, and content insights in new and engaging user experiences on the Netflix service.

From Red Notice to The Gray Man, The Adam Project to Hustle, Netflix brings the most talked about movies to viewers around the world.  The UCAN Film VFX team is composed of the most experienced and passionate professionals in the industry, who are dedicated to crafting unique stories that are captivating, imaginative and push the boundaries of what's possible for film content.

The Role
The Coordinator, VFX (Production Support) is the bridge between Netflix UCAN Film VFX department and our filmmakers (VFX Producers, VFX Production Managers, VFX Coordinators, etc). This role will interface day to day with our production teams, onboarding them to Netflix’s tools and workflows and providing logistical and technical support. A successful candidate will be self-motivated, flexible, thorough and able to juggle multiple and diverse responsibilities with a strong emphasis on organization and attention to detail. This position is fast moving and requires someone who is a positive and proactive thinker able to exercise good judgment with clear communication. A general proclivity towards seeking out and learning new software and technology that can assist in task management, is highly valued. Understanding the needs of our production teams is key.

lists.content:
• Support Title Management onboarding and workflows under guidance of Director of VFX.
  • Onboarding our external teams to tools: Starship, Production Center, ShotGrid, ContentHub, Distribution, DocuSign, Aspera, SyncSketch, and VFX Onboarding Site.
  • Assist in wrap / deliverables by onboarding vendors.
  • Assist in escalating issues and request to the appropriate helpdesk.
  • Liaise between the filmmakers and internal VFX team for tool support.
  • Seek out and master various proprietary Netflix tools.
  • Strategically planning on workflows to improve department needs.
  • Tracking/distributing computer servers for VFX and assisting in setting up servers utilizing third party vendors.
  • Daily tasks will include coordination and administration of service requests and managing all related record keeping (tracking and troubleshooting tickets in Zendesk).

• Ability to handle a fast paced environment assisting on several projects in various points of production (from development through delivery).
  • Proficiency in software such as Microsoft Word, Excel, Google Docs, Google Sheets, Google Slides and Google Mail.
  • Overall technical prowess with motivation to expand your knowledge base (tech curious).
  • Ability to respond after hours for important, timely or urgent matters and be discrete in maintaining confidential information.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills and the ability to multitask.
  • Strong organizational and data management skills.
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills.
  • Ability to work independently, identifying problems and taking lead on developing solutions.
  • 2+ Years in Visual Effects Production preferred.

lists.text: To be considered for this Role, you must have:

  • Good understanding of the audiovisual industry, and keen curiosity of the internet, media and entertainment industries,
  • Demonstrated good judgment, strong research and analytical skills, ability to work well under pressure, manage time and (re)prioritize tasks, and ability to collaborate with multiple teams simultaneously, 
  • An ability to cover a broad range of issues and work with a network of consultants, lawyers, and other partners,
  • Excellent written and verbal interpersonal communication skills in English and one of the CEE languages. Polish, Romanian or Czech language will be an advantage, 
  • Knowledge on Media and Copyright legislation.

descriptionPlain:
Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with over 222 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments. It’s an exciting time to work at Netflix and be part of a public company with a great consumer brand and to help Netflix shape the future of entertainment.

The Opportunity

The APAC Pan-regional Events Specialist operates as the leader for the corporate events function and blends strategic thinking with execution at scale. In this role, you’re expected to be a self-starter, who can look ‘around the corner’ before issues arise. You’re highly adept at communicating across all levels of the company and you possess strong business acumen. That is, you’re not only a leader for events, you should also have the ability to understand the needs of the business and have industry and Netflix-specific knowledge about how things get done and why. You should pride yourself on innovation, drawing on a large network of external partners to deliver across a wide range of events & experiences.

The APAC Corporate Events Specialist will be responsible for leading and driving the strategy and execution across our portfolio of corporate events: regional Annual Business Review (ABR), employee events, a variety of thought-leadership panels and discussions, and regional events across APAC. As one of the first Corp Events hires in APAC, you will be responsible for carving out the function with inputs and collaboration from across Internal Comms, Talent, Brand, External Comms,  N-Tech, ERGs, Workplace, and local country leadership teams.

They will have lived and/or worked within the APAC region OR have had experience working with the APAC region. They are able to make wise decisions and think strategically, even when faced with ambiguity. This person can articulate what they are - and are not - trying to do with clarity and can give transparent visibility into their process. They are organized, thorough, and not afraid to get their hands dirty - which means jumping in to handle tasks that range from hiring an agency, planning an event, maintaining and updating guest lists, booking a venue, or working a check-in table.  They will be proactive and instinctively identify new opportunities or ways of working more effectively. They will be eager to learn, rabidly curious, and contribute outside of their specialty. 

A successful candidate will play a key role in strategizing, executing, and managing events across our offices in APAC and will work alongside stakeholders in helping to create, shape, execute and manage employee event strategy. These events include, but are not limited to, regional all-hands, officewide company meetings, large employee celebrations, recruiting events, new hire onboarding, inclusion & diversity initiatives, and office-wide all-hands company meetings and celebrations. This role will be based in our Korea office with frequent travel to our other regional offices.

With highly successful German series and films such as  “How to sell drugs online (fast),”, “The Empress” and “All Quiet on the Western Front” Netflix seeks an attorney to join Netflix’s growing content slate in DACH.
Based in our Berlin office, the role is on the Business & Legal Affairs team and will be focused on supporting the growing slate of Netflix original scripted series, non-fiction and film content produced in German language. The head of Business & Legal Affairs is based in Amsterdam.
 
 The candidate will assist in scaling our German language content operations, working alongside creative partners to structure content development and production agreements. In doing so, the candidate will be responsible for understanding the legal landscape and production customs, and executing on Netflix’s strategy as necessary to develop and produce local content for Netflix’s global streaming platform. 
 
In particular, the candidate will be involved in negotiating production deals for programming either with local production partners or directly with talent and representatives, as well as overseeing business and legal affairs matters during production. The ideal candidate will have direct experience with deal-making and production legal issues in the German film & TV marketplace across the genres.  The role requires knowledge of the legal intricacies in the German media sector, a facility in creative thinking, good judgment, the ability to collaborate strongly within a team, and the flexibility to quickly pivot within a strategy.

descriptionPlain:
With more than 180 million memberships in over 190 countries, it is an exciting time to work at Netflix.  We have brought Netflix to virtually all countries around the globe and we are excited to bring even more of our local and regional programming to our viewers everywhere.
  
As part of the Mumbai-based team, you will help define the Netflix brand and shape the future of entertainment in an environment where collaboration between legal and business thrives. The Mumbai team will have the opportunity to grow India into one of Netflix’s leading markets. 
 
Netflix seeks a seasoned and intellectually curious individual to join Netflix’s growing Indian content initiative, focused on creating and acquiring local content in India. 

The successful candidate will be a key member of the Business & Legal Affairs team and will work closely alongside creative partners, producers, and talents to structure content deals and harmonize Netflix objectives within production frameworks. The individual will be responsible for negotiating and papering deals in a fast-paced environment, build and manage robust relationships with key production partners, and implement the business and legal customs necessary to develop and produce local content for Netflix’s global digital streaming service. The ideal candidate will be very comfortable driving business objectives, counseling creative partners, collaborating with global partners, and making decisions that have both business and legal impact.  
  
The ideal candidate will welcome the opportunity to be part of a fast‐paced, entrepreneurial organization and thrive in communicating in a global environment.

REQUIREMENTS
 
The successful candidate should have 6+ years of broad‐based experience in drafting, commercial negotiations and business understanding. Experience in liaising and negotiating with talent, production companies, and studios, media and financing will be preferred. Bilingual in English and Hindi is highly preferred.

descriptionPlain:
Netflix is in search of an experienced lawyer to handle a wide array of responsibilities related to Netflix’s Live Experiences touring business. 

Part of the Netflix Consumer Products & Experiences umbrella, the Live Experiences team at Netflix creates, develops and produces all forms of location-based entertainment based on Netflix’s series and film properties. Through immersive, in-person, ticketed experiences that expand and enhance stories from the screen, the Live Experiences team allows fans to directly interact with the Netflix portfolio of titles. Recent successes include BRIDGERTON: THE QUEEN’S BALL, STRANGER THINGS: THE EXPERIENCE, STRANGER THINGS: THE OFFICIAL STORE (a multi-city retail pop up), and the multi-title retail experience at the Grove mall in Los Angeles. Previous projects include the LA CASA DE PAPEL experience; Army of the Dead VR Experience; COVID-friendly Stranger Things Drive Into Experience; and the all-digital NAILED IT! At Home Baking Challenge. 

The Role
You will be the Business & Legal Affairs point person for global touring and traveling Live Experiences, including:  day-to-day production and operational legal matters (e.g., venue and vendor agreements, merchandise and food/beverage offerings, health and safety, production partnership agreements); license agreements with third-party experiences partners; legal and risk assessments relating to marketing and creative; and collaborating with other counsel and business owners on business strategy (including on the development of new creative concepts and projects). This role collaborates closely with other internal commercial executives and cross-functional partners, such as tax, accounting/finance, real estate, content, IP/trademark, labor, litigation, and other legal functions across Netflix. 

In this role,  you should be extremely comfortable counseling commercial partners and making decisions that have both legal and business impacts, and should be adept at developing and fostering relationships. Practical risk evaluation, nimble decision making and willingness to pivot are critical indicators for success in this role. descriptionPlain:
It's an exciting time to join Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment globally. We bring new stories to over 222 million people in over 190 countries worldwide by promoting our original, exclusive content. A key growth factor is our ability to empower Netflix personnel to utilize in-house-built cutting-edge technology that maximizes studio/production efficiencies to facilitate creation of the world’s best streaming content. 

Like all great companies, we strive to hire the best and we value integrity, excellence, respect, inclusivity, and collaboration. What is special about Netflix, among other things, is our Culture.

The Team 
The Content & Business Product Success team uniquely sits between the teams developing the software products for Netflix Studio and the Studio employees & external partners who utilize these products to get their work done. We are a Success Team that actively engages with cross-functional teams from both organizations on a daily basis to help drive change management, lead user education, assist with go-to-market launch campaigns, positively influence product adoption, and partner in closing feedback loops to both end user stakeholders and the Product teams. Our main goal is to empower all users (internal & external) of Netflix technology to do their jobs faster, easier, and smarter while gaining value toward their business goals. What we learn from doing this turns into feedback shared with the product teams that influences product development. If you are an early tech adopter and enjoy creating new pathways to help others do their best work and drive change/innovation, this is the space for you. 

The Role
The Customer (User/Client) Success Manager is responsible for developing education strategy and implementation of blended and scalable learning solutions for Netflix-built apps. CSM’s will also foster relationships with our application user groups; define, evangelize, and manage our product feedback loop; and provide user health insights to our Product partners. This role requires global thinking and proactive regional partnership to reach internal and external users around the world. This person must be passionate about helping users gain value out of software and be able to understand nuanced workflows across several products that are connected in an ecosystem.

Overview 

The Netflix Global Public Policy team is a highly talented and experienced group of experts from diverse backgrounds who work in close partnership with their business counterparts to advance the strategic goals of the company. 

Within the Global Public Policy team, the Strategic Engagement and Analytics (SEAL) team acts as an operational center of excellence supporting our policy peers globally to build a positive narrative and evidence for their specific strategies. The SEAL team is seeking a Data Analyst to join its team; the Data Analyst will report to the Director, Data & Intelligence, Strategic Engagement and Analytics.  This position may be based in Los Angeles or Los Gatos. 

Responsibilities

*Perform data analysis and develop dashboards, reports, presentations and data products that present insights in an intuitive manner
*Source, bring in and work with external data sets where needed
*Identify opportunities to tell new data stories 
*Work closely with cross-functional partners to ensure that the Public Policy team is able to leverage data across the business
*Articulate findings clearly to Policy teams and their stakeholders, in different formats

Qualifications

*3-5 years of relevant experience in a highly analytical environment, which can include data analytics and visualization, finance, economics or management consulting 
*University degree in economics, data science or engineering, finance, statistics or related field

*Knowledge of at least one major programming language (e.g. Python)
*Experience with BI/visualizations tools such as Tableau and Google Data Studio

The successful candidate should also have the ability to

*Organize, analyze and exploit data using statistical techniques
*Think creatively and leverage data for the needs of the policy team
*Communicate efficiently with a wide variety of technical and non-technical partners
*Work independently in a fast-paced, dynamic environment

Nice to have

*An understanding of the media/entertainment sector would be an advantage
*Experience working with Public Policy, Communications or Strategy teams a plus
*Culture is very important at Netflix and we value it highly. Read here to learn more.

descriptionPlain:
At Netflix, we want to entertain the world and are constantly innovating on how entertainment is imagined, created and delivered to a global audience. We currently stream content in more than 30 languages in 190 countries, topping over 220 million paid subscribers and are expanding into new forms of entertainment such as gaming. Engineering teams within Netflix work hard every day to scale and innovate this content production and member experience in an ever growing complex software landscape
 
We pride ourselves on using data to inform our decision-making as we work towards our mission. This requires curating data across various domains across the company. All of this data collection and curation is made possible thanks to the amazing Data Engineers of Netflix who bring this data to life.

 As part of the Acquisition & Finance Engineering team, we're responsible for enabling the business to make smart decisions about how we account, spend, and plan for all of the money that's related to our content. We have embarked on a journey to create a financial data universe for our business users. This helps enable well-informed decision-making by unifying financially relevant data across systems and supports efficient, self-service access to business insights at scale. As a data engineer focused on Netflix’s financial data universe, you will have a huge ownership and responsibility for enabling the business' critical decisions. You will be responsible for creating reliable, distributed data pipelines and building intuitive data models that allow our stakeholders to easily leverage data in a self-service manner. You will be expected to show thought leadership and partner effectively with our engineering teams, analysts, and business partners to push the company forward

With 200+ million paid members in over 190 countries on millions of devices; enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages - Netflix is reinventing entertainment from end to end. Data Engineering at Netflix is a role that requires building systems to process data efficiently and modeling the data to power analytics. In addition, we require our Data Engineers to have a rich understanding of large distributed systems on which our data solutions rely. Candidates should have knowledge across several of these skill sets and usually need to be deep in at least one. As a Data Engineer, you also need to have strong communication skills since you will need to collaborate with business, engineering, and data science teams to enable a culture of learning. Learn more about the work of data engineers at Netflix.

Location of work: We are considering candidates who are willing to relocate to Los Gatos, California, as well as fully-remote candidates (remote in the US with occasional visits to Los Gatos) depending on the team your skills are most aligned with.

descriptionPlain:
Netflix is enjoyed by more than 200 million members globally, entertaining new audiences every day.  Netflix’s cloud platform plays a key role in making the Netflix experience great.  We are one of the pioneers of leveraging a highly scalable distributed cloud footprint to deliver delightful experiences to our members worldwide. 

The Security and Platform Data Engineering team builds data products which enable architecting secure, reliable, scalable, and efficient platforms. We partner with our security and platform engineering teams to empower them with data for smarter decision making and innovative solutions to challenging problems. 

This role is specifically focused on enabling our cloud platforms to scale effectively and efficiently. Through our data products we enable engineering teams which build and manage our compute platform, our custom big data platform, productivity tools, network architecture, capacity and demand planning.

We are looking for a Senior Data Engineer to build reliable data pipelines and intuitive data products that allow our stakeholders to easily leverage data in an effective  manner. As part of this team, you will work on diverse data technologies such as Spark, Presto, Flink, Kafka and others to build insightful, scalable and robust data pipelines; write ETL jobs to collect and aggregate data; and build high quality data models that describe the entities, interactions and usage of Netflix’ cloud infrastructure. 

The ideal candidate will have a strong background in distributed data processing, have great and demonstrable data intuition, and share our passion for continuously improving the ways we use data to make the Netflix infrastructure better.

Netflix is one of the world's leading streaming entertainment services with 231 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, feature films and mobile games across a wide variety of genres and languages. We are revolutionizing how shows and movies are produced, pushing technological boundaries to efficiently deliver streaming video at a massive scale over the internet, and continuously improving and personalizing how content is presented around the globe. 

We’re looking for a passionate Research Data Scientist to join our Consumer Insights Data Management & Analytics (DM&A) team. This team leverages technical expertise in applied data science, engineering, and solutions development to support a high-impact team of 90+ quantitative and qualitative researchers. The Consumer Insights team conducts cutting-edge research designed to help answer Netflix’s most complex business challenges. You will collaborate with researchers, data scientists, and engineers to build next-generation data pipelines, models, and products to ensure excellence in the quality and accessibility of our insights and help answer Netflix’s most complex business challenges. This is a high-impact role in which you will directly influence and establish scalable research programs at Netflix.

Visit our Research page to learn about what it’s like to work on Analytics at Netflix.

While technical depth is an important requirement, your success in this role will be equally dependent on your ability to communicate and collaborate with a diverse group of stakeholders and teams.

descriptionPlain:
At Netflix, we want to entertain the world and are constantly innovating on how entertainment is imagined, created and delivered to a global audience. We currently stream content in more than 30 languages in 190 countries, topping over 220 million paid subscribers and are expanding into new forms of entertainment such as gaming.  

The data infrastructure teams at Netflix enable us to leverage data to bring joy to our members in many different ways. We provide centralized data platforms and tools for various business functions at Netflix, so they can utilize our data to make critical data-driven decisions. We do all the heavy lifting to make it easy for our business partners to work with data efficiently, securely, and responsibly. We aspire to lead the industry standard in building a world-class data infrastructure, as Netflix leads the way to be the most popular and pervasive destination for global internet entertainment.

We are looking for distributed systems engineers to help evolve and innovate our infrastructure as we work towards our ambitious goal of 500 million members worldwide. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive team to bring new perspectives as we solve the next set of challenges. In addition, we are open to remote candidates. We value what you can do, from anywhere in the U.S.   

Spotlight on Data Infrastructure Teams: 

Big Data Compute | Learn More
Responsible for providing the cloud-native platform for distributed data processing at Netflix. This team is central to batch data processing in Data Platform. It provides support for Spark, to ETL data into the Petabytes-scale data warehouse and access that data using Spark and Presto/TrinoDB. It also provides sub-second latency for a certain class of queries using Druid.We are looking for exceptional talent with experience in Spark, Presto / Trino, Druid, Iceberg and distributed database systems in general. Roles in this team involve solving super interesting and challenging problems of working with data at scale, building features and performance enhancements and working closely with open source communities to shape the projects and make contributions.

Online Datastores | Learn More
Offers data stores as a managed service, including both caching and persistence stores. Caching stores include Dynomite (redis), EVCache (memcached) and persistence stores include Cassandra and CockroachDB. Responsibilities include development of data plane and control plane, reliability and availability of the data stores. Datastores directly impact critical call paths across multiple business units of Netflix including Streaming, Original content production (Studio), Gaming and Tudum.

Realtime Data Engines | Learn More
Offers low level building blocks for the transport and processing of realtime data. For data transport we offer Kafka; for data processing we offer Flink and Mantis. Responsibilities include development of the control plane, compute resource management, reliability and availability of the data. Realtime data is critical across many business units of Netflix including Streaming, Gaming, Finance and Machine Learning platforms.

Metadata Platform | Learn More
Responsible for the broader data strategy at Netflix by providing visibility into the taxonomy and business context of all Netflix datasets. We own the Netflix-wide data catalog, central Schema registry for all data stores in the Data Platform, Data Lineage service and an extensible Policy Engine. We also own Metacat, which is our foundational and critical operational Metadata store that enables Big Data Processing and Compute. 

Storage and Insights | Learn More 
Offers storage and insights products. Those products provide storage services to platforms, applications and users around the globe which are performant, secure and centrally managed; enabling platforms to move, store and efficiently archive data in the cloud. We offer a consistent mechanism to create & manage S3 resources, integrate Netflix ecosystem for access control and provide observability into the cost & resource lifecycle of these resources, by taking ownership of existing tools and shaping a more cohesive strategy.

Data Movement and Processing Platform | Learn More 
Offers an abstracted self-service paved-paved path product to enable varied user persona across Netflix meet their low-latency Data Movement and Processing requirements; enables abstraction over complex Real-Time frameworks such as Kafka and Flink; offers a Schema driven processing experience; invests in operational automation, reliability and tools for predictable data quality.

descriptionPlain:
Netflix is the world's leading internet entertainment service with over 222 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. This is a great opportunity to join our Korean office and drive the best execution on marketing campaigns, on both quality and scale, as we continue to aggressively grow our slate of local and global original, exclusive content.

The Opportunity
The Dubbing Title Manager will be the main liaison to local teams, managing titles for their respective territory on the Dubbing team.  The ideal candidate is an organized, strategic thinker that thrives in managing a multitude of tasks while safeguarding all title-level requirements. You will be working on Netflix's growing catalog to manage long form project progress, quality control, and the launch of all dubbed assets. Managing end-to-end dubbing includes working closely with internal and external partners to direct and/or influence outcomes even amidst ambiguity. This is a demanding and fast-moving position that requires someone who can maintain a holistic approach while getting as tactical as necessary to deliver the content. Applicants must work across all components of Dubbing alongside in-territory teams to produce high quality global audio assets in up to 36+ languages.  

As a Dubbing Title Manager, you will be responsible for how members experience dubbed audio, ensuring Netflix customers across the globe get the highest quality experience from our localized audio assets. As we continue to add support for new languages and expand our global membership, providing best-in-class localized content is critical to our success.

  • Consistently develop relationships with our Netflix original content teams to identify the challenges and complexities of localization on titles and address them strategically.
  • Capability to work with showrunners/filmmakers on titles to assess the intention of the original version and determine appropriate creative support and guidance for character/cast management, title sensitivities, and consistency across the title’s localization strategy. 
  • Foster and support consistent communication with cross-functional teams, including Content Acquisitions, Language Production, Post-Production, Marketing, Legal, Globalization, Business Affairs, etc., to ensure strategy alignment around the global distribution of Netflix original content.

  • Highly analytical and able to get to the root cause of a problem; creatively figure out a solution or propose changes to existing workflows as required.
  • Adaptability and resilience to rapidly evolving priorities, technology, tools, and workflows.
  • Identify and manage risk through prioritization, troubleshooting, and other means necessary.
  • Develop business and cultural awareness of territory nuances related to dubbing, costs, talent, and workflows.
  • Ability to handle a fast-paced environment, supervising several projects in various production points (from development through delivery).
  • Contribute to the company's culture of curiosity and self-disciplined pro-active responsibility as part of the Dubbing team.
  • A sincere passion for the Dubbing landscape and the future of content creation.
  • Strong organizational skills with a proactive mentality and creative problem-solving abilities.
  • Willing to constantly question existing systems and look for a better way.
  • Willing to travel as needed.
  • Bachelor's degree preferred and/or equivalent, relevant work experience.
  • Fluency in English and Korean is required.

At Netflix, the Editorial Insights (EI) team brings context to content — classifying it, describing it, and capturing its essence — to help connect our members to content they’ll love.

As a senior member of the EI Strategy team, the Editorial Innovation Lead will guide a variety of global projects from ideation to execution, each with the ultimate goal of maximizing our ability to capture the essence of titles on Netflix.

descriptionPlain:
From “Mellow TV Shows” to “Live-Action Movies based on Manga,” the system that powers Netflix’s multitudes of personalized row recommendations is the result of years of painstaking content analysis, intricate taxonomical work, data science, and pure movie and TV geekery.

If you are an avid fan and a serious consumer of visual entertainment, the Editorial Creative team at Netflix is seeking a unique candidate who can capture the essence of Japanese movies and TV shows and turn that into data and information. descriptionPlain:
At Netflix we do one thing - entertainment - and we aim to do it really well. To accomplish this goal, we must produce, distribute, and stream content at a massive scale. We have a strong engineering organization that enables us to achieve these business objectives and a unique and creative culture that guides us to operate with “Freedom and Responsibility”. This helps keep engineering velocity high, but also means that our security team needs to operate differently than a traditional security team. Employees have tremendous freedom in their work, along with the corresponding responsibility to do the right thing for Netflix. Instead of controlling engineers with process and security gates, we enable them to build secure code and provide them with adequate security context to make the right decisions for Netflix.

The Application and Infrastructure Security (AIS) team aims to reduce risk in our engineering ecosystem through strategic security initiatives in high-risk or high-leverage areas. We conduct risk discovery, security strategy development and execution, identification and execution of  high impact security initiatives across Netflix applications and infrastructure (e.g. Network security strategy for Netflix corporate infrastructure, Secure Application Gateway for all internal applications). 

The AIS team operates across a broad scope and helps guide security investments for our engineering stakeholders. We are looking for a strong engineering leader and people manager for this team to enable our mission and scale this program. You will be responsible for leading and cultivating a world class team of senior security engineers. You will drive the strategy for engineering security investments in close collaboration with key partners with a pragmatic, risk focused approach.

lists.text: We are looking for someone who:
lists.content:
• Has a strong accounting background and knowledge of external reporting and applicable regulations for statutory compliance across multiple countries (mainly but not limited to Mexico, Colombia, & Argentina);
  • Is a hands-on: strategic thinker that also dives down into operational and execution aspects while focusing on the “big picture”;
  • Has strong analytical capabilities, demonstrated by attention to detail + love for data. You will produce high-quality work, scrutinizing significant numbers and system data to reconcile accounts and solve problems; 
  • Is an excellent team player who is adept at working as part of a larger team located in different locations inserted in a multicultural environment;
  • Has outstanding communication and interpersonal skills;
  • Has a passion for accounting & financial reporting, and general finance;
  • Is a self-star who can manage workload effectively and autonomously;
  • Is comfortable multitasking, prioritizing, and meeting multiple tight deadlines.

• Driving operational process improvements in a fast-paced environment.
  • Communicating effectively and building strong working relationships with external advisors and internal teams. 
  • Using analytics to design and set up standardized procedures and intelligent (systems/ automation) solutions on reporting requirements.
  • Influencing and leading change with a positive, energetic, and inclusive style.
  • Working with teams across multiple time zones to collaborate with our US and International offices. 
  • Overseeing multiple balance sheet accounts and the corresponding sub-ledger for varying levels of complexity and materiality;
  • Understanding how systems work together to drive improvements and automation where possible. You will proactively identify gaps in current systems and lead cross-functional work to design, test, and roll out new techniques and tools;

  • Partnering with cross-functional colleagues across finance, tax, and IT organizations, providing financial and accounting guidance and leadership to deliver unique projects;

  • Knowledge of IFRS (or IFRS equivalent) and/or any other local GAAP in LATAM;
  • 8+ years relevant accounting experience, preferably at a large, fast-growing, multi-national company (Big Four experience is a plus);
  • Experience with preparing statutory filing documentation for international entities;
  • Experience collecting international accounting and tax requirements;
  • Tech/Entertainment industry experience is a plus but not essential if you are enthusiastic about the position, have a strong accounting background, and are capable of learning quickly;
  • Advanced English and Spanish are a must.

descriptionPlain:
We’re looking for a creative and highly-skilled Game Director to help us forge the game direction and creative vision on a brand-new AAA PC game. As Game Director, you will be the creative leader of one of Netflix’s first generation of internally developed original games. You will provide the vision and direction for the game from the concept phase, through production, launch, and live operations. The right candidate will bring industry-leading craft expertise and attention to detail to generate the vision for a game that is high quality, emotionally resonant, iconic, and full of heart.  Creating a great game that players want to come back to repeatedly is our primary goal - you will be able to create, ship and run a game without any competing design constraints due to monetization. 

We're building the foundation for a small, but ambitious team of creators.  We’re looking for that group of key leaders who are aligned with our core values, and care deeply about the experiences they create as well as the people they make them with.  Those who bias towards action and are energized by the learning that comes with bold experimentation at an agile pace. As a part of Netflix, we strive to hire the best and value integrity, excellence, respect, inclusion, and collaboration. 

Now is an amazing time to join Netflix as we seek to entertain the world. We have over 200 million paid members in over 190 countries, and we won’t stop there.

descriptionPlain:
At Netflix, we are shaping the future of global entertainment because we believe there is a better way to watch. Our members need our help from time to time, and that’s where our Global Customer Service (CS) organization focuses on providing amazing interactions with our subscribers around the world. Our goal is excellence, simplicity and getting our members back to streaming.

Netflix is looking for a talented Curriculum Developer to join our Global CS Learning & Development (L&D) team. This role will support the learning needs of the outsourced call centers that make up our Global CS Operations in APAC, EMEA, and The Americas.

Our Global CS L&D team provides leadership, customer service, and tools training that has a direct impact on our agents, our customers, and the business. This role reports to the Learning & Development Manager, Global Curriculum and will have the opportunity to develop effective and engaging learning experiences for the best call center agents and leaders in the industry.

Responsibilities

Needs Assessment/Research
Research key characteristics and responsibilities of the audience to understand role expectations. Using a variety of inputs, perform gap analysis to address performance problems and drive innovation. Prioritize the identified gaps and recommend curriculum-based interventions for technical and behavioral skills. As a strategic partner to the CS business, document and present methods, findings, and recommendations to address performance gaps.

Instructional Design/Training Development
Research content and collaborate with cross-functional subject matter experts to design and develop accurate, globally consistent training content (e.g., facilitator and student materials, presentation media, job aids, and knowledge checks). Develop solutions (e.g., instructor-led, virtual, self-paced, blended, etc.) that provide relevant, challenging, and productive learning experiences. Finalize materials through reviews, pilot tests, etc.

Program Management
Define, document, and maintain the scope of learning programs. Create, track, and maintain project plans. Communicate clearly inside and outside the team. Develop a trusting partnership and work closely with global and regional stakeholders to ensure alignment around key priorities. Use data to demonstrate the impact of training programs.

descriptionPlain:
ABOUT OUR TEAM
We’re a group of developers, artists, and storytellers that make games full of wonder, danger, and humor. Everyone at our studio, whether an industry vet or new voice impacts each game through collaborative feedback, mutual respect, and creative empowerment. If you want to make games leave a meaningful impact on players: we want to hear from you.
 
We’re looking for new teammates who deeply care about the work they do, the stories they tell, and the people they create with. As part of the Netflix team, we strive to hire the best and value integrity, excellence, respect, inclusion, and collaboration.
 
Due to the pandemic, we are currently working from home with limited time in our studio. We plan to return to working in-person at our Los Angeles studio in the near future.
 
Learn how our story-loving game people came to join Netflix’s team of game-loving story people.
 
ENGINEERING AT NIGHT SCHOOL
Coding is just as creative as other roles at Night School. Our engineering team highly values cross-disciplinary thinking. Creating great gameplay experiences requires engineers to not only imagine elegant, extensible, and optimized systems, but also to appreciate, communicate, and integrate with matters of art, design, and narrative. Here, you’ll flex your ingenuity and skill in multiple areas as needs arise, whether directly in our games, as part of a development support system, or as part of our in-house storytelling toolset, NightTools.
 
ABOUT THE ROLE
We are looking for a talented, driven, and passionate graphics engineer to own and maintain the studio’s rendering pipelines. You’ll serve as a studio-wide resource for building and maintaining render pipelines and advanced render techniques on all projects. Working closely with the art and engineering teams, you’ll create world-class visual styles and effects. The ideal candidate is intimately familiar with modern real-time rendering techniques, but also has enough of an eye for visual art to communicate with artists effectively

lists.text: A successful candidate in this role will have three key skills:
lists.content:
