You have an intellectual, problem-solver and strategic mind with the ability to synthesize data, insights, and feedback from multiple sources. You are comfortable in translating abstract ideas and information into concrete short-term and long-term bets that support Netflix’s growth.
  • You have a visionary perspective of the payments landscape and demonstrate a strategic vision and judgment in payments. You present broad experience influencing external stakeholders whether it be negotiating a commercial contract or shaping new products.
  • You are known by internal and external stakeholders as collaborative and inspirational. You foster strong relationships and alignment across different stakeholders within and outside the organization with a proven track record building a network in the industry.
  • In order to be successful at Netflix, you must be able to anticipate and meet ever-increasing business demands while demonstrating strong judgment in the face of ambiguity.  You must thrive in a fast-paced and demanding environment, possess a high level of intellectual curiosity, and focus on generating results all while exhibiting the highest level of personal and professional integrity. You are someone who is comfortable and confident interacting with all levels of an organization and with the ability to operate independently and someone who welcomes failure as a learning opportunity. You will be asked to frequently represent the Payments team across the company and debate controversial topics with our executives

lists.text: You will be a high-impact individual contributor whose responsibilities will include, but not be limited to:
lists.content:
• Make use of our payments infrastructure to improve the performance of existing payment methods, while evaluating any new payment methods that prove to have incremental value
  • Seek out innovation in the payments domain by considering consumer’s needs, relevant regulatory and technological trends that could influence Netflix’s approach to payments in the short-term vs. the long-term 
  • Work alongside the Partnerships team on managing relationships with financial institutions, card schemes, and fintechs in order to drive best-in-class payment performance and innovation
  • Own key payment metrics for your markets and derive actionable insights into improving the experience for our customers, improving performance, and ensuring efficient cost structures
  • Partner cross-functionally throughout the organization (Product, Engineering, CS, Legal, Marketing, Finance, etc.) to get things done - whether that be optimization or market expansion and launching features and products that will drive growth in our business

• 10+ years of experience managing very large CNP/recurring payments, either from a merchant, issuer or acquirer perspective
  • Deep knowledge of payments technologies relevant to the U.S. and Canada (e.g. network tokens, PINless, Faster Payments, ACH, etc.) 
  • Highly analytical with the ability to use data to make decisions
  • Deep experience partnering and negotiating with card processors, card schemes, banks and fintechs
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Impeccable judgment and integrity; ability to make key decisions quickly and autonomously
  • Existing network of relationships across the U.S. and Canada payments ecosystem
  • Ability to juggle multiple critical tasks simultaneously
  • Bachelor's degree, MBA a plus
  • Additional languages a plus
  • Willingness to travel as needed across the US and Canada regions

The Studio Finance team works closely with our partners in production management, innovation, creative services and facilities planning across EMEA to provide strategic and financial guidance on core business decisions.  A core part of the Studio Finance team is overseeing Production Finance - the budgeting and management of title level spend. 

The Studio Finance team continues to grow across EMEA, the 2nd largest Netflix Region after UCAN to support local content production increase and our development in each market. EMEA Finance management team is based in Amsterdam and our studio finance team is now deployed in all major markets across Europe.
 
About the role
This role is a key in-region lead with the opportunity to shape the vision of the expanding Netflix Studio across EMEA.  We are seeking a seasoned and strategic executive to lead this large team. The successful candidate will be proactive, flexible, and able to juggle multiple and diverse responsibilities. 

The Head of Studio Finance & Strategy will be instrumental in working with the  Netflix Studio leadership team. As a head of this team, you’ll be working with the regional leaders across Production Management, Post Production, VFX, Production Facilities Management & Operations, Creative Services, Dubbing, etc).  
 
This leader will have a high degree of visibility with our C-level executives and other senior management within the organization to accurately model and forecast the business as well as lead the strategic analysis that is used to inform important business decisions. The leader will also oversee a large team spread around production hubs throughout Europe.

descriptionPlain:
About Netflix

Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with over 204 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments.

Netflix in Korea

Netflix is working very closely with the Korean Content Creators, and heavily investing in the Korean Creative ecosystem, which already proved its creative excellence & potential to the world. It is important to note that as part of efforts on inclusive growth not only for Netflix but also for the Korean Contents, Netflix invested more than one trillion KRW since its launch in 2016 until 2021. Netflix continues to provide a wide range of investment and support towards Korean Contents and its creative ecosystem in the market. Through these efforts, Netflix introduced more than 130 Korean films and series to our worldwide audience across more than 190 countries. 

Talent Acquisition at Netflix

TA is a high priority at Netflix, and we operate in a unique recruiting environment in which hiring the best -- vs. “making the hire” -- is the constant guide. We immerse ourselves in the businesses of the teams which we partner with as a requirement for understanding what great talent looks like, and influencing towards the right hire.

The TA Leadership Opportunity

As the TA Manager for Korea, you will own recruiting for the market, and in doing so will have a direct and outsized impact on Netflix’s success in the market, but also on the broader APAC region, and on Netflix as a whole. In practice, this means setting the TA strategy for and driving the execution of, hiring the diverse set of world-class creative, content, and marketing talent needed to realize the massive market potential in Korea.

descriptionPlain:
Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with 221 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, feature films, and mobile games across a wide variety of genres and languages. The position is based in Alphaville, Sao Paulo, and reports to the Manager of Investigations & Response. This individual will work in close collaboration with teams such as Legal, Product, Engineering, Public Policy, and other cross-functional teams to carry out their responsibilities.

descriptionPlain:
At Netflix, we are passionate about delivering joy to hundreds of millions of Netflix members around the world, whether they’re traveling to a remote location or at home with family.  The iOS mobile application brings Netflix to our members, wherever they may be, and the iOS Client Foundations team is responsible for building the frameworks, core technologies, and underlying architecture of the Netflix iOS application. 

This team builds paved-path solutions that address the needs of iOS UI product engineers, including app architecture, data access (e.g. GraphQL), quality of experience (QoE), and client observability. This team also operates as a central hub for iOS at Netflix, bringing iOS engineers together across the engineering organization for conversations, learning and community.

We are looking for an experienced engineering manager to lead the iOS Client Foundations team and drive technology investments needed to scale the iOS product. With Netflix’s focus on international growth and new forms of entertainment such as games, there is a growing demand for mobile product innovations that increase value for our members worldwide. The work of the iOS Client Foundations team enables us to iterate quickly on product AB tests while having confidence in the quality of the product. In this role, you will collaborate with other senior, high-performing engineers and leaders to pursue challenging and novel opportunities.

descriptionPlain:
At Netflix, we launch a high volume of titles regularly to meet the entertainment needs of our growing member base. The scale and quality at which we launch titles is paramount to our success in bringing these stories to the right audience at the right time. The Launch Management team ensures that we launch our regional portfolio of titles at the highest quality and in the most efficient way possible to maximize member joy.

The Launch Manager role is unique as its scope requires a deep understanding of our product behavior and a mindset that is equally precise on local execution as it is on strategic judgment calls. The LM’s role is to optimize the content and product strategy, and we do this via effective management of our highest impact areas, leading cross-functional alignment on a portfolio level, and being part of initiatives on innovating and productizing new product experiences. Thorough knowledge of the local and vertical strategies, business nuances, and technical troubleshooting paired with strong partnership investment with stakeholders will be critical to our success.

You will be part of a larger Creative Production Operations team that will innovate approaches to tooling, vendors and quality to develop scalable solutions and measurements for the quality of our launches so that we can work smarter and increase efficiency. This role is based in Mumbai and focused on supporting the India content slate.

Netflix is building a new internal game studio to incubate and build an exciting new 3rd person action RPG.

The Lead Engineer will partner closely with the Creative Director and assemble a new core game team to rapidly prototype and iterate towards a new game vision. As a part of Netflix, we strive to hire the best and value integrity, excellence, respect, inclusion, and collaboration. 

Now is an amazing time to join Netflix Game Studio as we seek to  entertain our 200 million paid members in a really new way.

Netflix, the world's leading streaming entertainment service, seeks an experienced litigator to join the legal team for Latin America (LATAM).
This is an exciting and challenging role in a fast-paced environment with responsibility for handling litigation matters, both directly and indirectly, as well as pre-litigation counseling on a wide variety of topics.  This role would also provide leadership and support to the LATAM consumer claims and law enforcement (CCLE) team, providing strategic guidance and mentorship to legal professionals who manage consumer litigation and respond to inquiries from law enforcement and consumer regulatory agencies throughout the region.  

The role sits within the Core Legal group and involves close and ongoing collaboration with stakeholders throughout the company. Strong risk tolerance, an experienced perspective on litigation and litigation risk, and an ability to understand and manage multiple internal resources dealing with cutting-edge legal issues are critical in this role. This role is headquartered in Alphaville, Brazil, and reports to both the Head of Core Legal for LATAM and to the VP of Litigation.  

This is an opportunity to be part of a public company with a great consumer brand and to help Netflix shape the future of digital media. The ideal candidate will welcome the opportunity to be part of a fast‐paced and entrepreneurial organization where freedom and responsibility are core values, and passion, innovation, and curiosity are key.  Visit our culture memo and long-term view to learn more about the unique Netflix culture and the opportunity to be part of our team.

NOTE: This job posting is inclusive of a variety of positions within our Algorithms Engineering group. Based on your background, expertise and interests, we will route you to the appropriate team(s). 

Netflix is the world's leading internet entertainment service with over 220 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, feature films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch videos and play games as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. 

To achieve our mission of entertaining the world, we are reinventing entertainment from end to end. We are revolutionizing how shows, movies, and games are produced, pushing technological boundaries to efficiently deliver streaming video at massive scale over the internet, and continuously improving the discovery and personalization of our offerings to our global user base using Machine Learning and data analytics.

Applied Machine Learning Research at Netflix improves various aspects of our business, including personalization, recommendations, search, content understanding, messaging, targeting, new member acquisition etc. As such, our research spans many Machine Learning areas, including deep learning, search and recommender systems, causal inference, reinforcement learning and bandits, computer vision, computer graphics, natural language processing, and computational advertising. 

We are looking for exceptional individuals to work full time with us as research scientists. In this role, you will conduct applied research by conceptualizing, designing, implementing, and validating potential algorithmic improvements. This includes researching and applying cutting edge machine learning algorithms, running offline experiments, and building online A/B tests to run in production systems. To be successful in this role, you need a strong machine learning background, solid software development skills, a love of learning, a passion for solving end-user problems and to collaborate well in multi-disciplinary teams. You will need to exhibit strong communication and leadership skills, an ability to set priorities, and an execution focus in a dynamic environment. 

What we are looking for:
- A burning desire to solve real world problems at scale by applying Machine Learning
- PhD or Masters in Computer Science, Statistics, or any of the related fields
- 5+ years of research experience with a track record of delivering quality results
- Expertise in machine learning spanning supervised and unsupervised learning methods
- Experience in successfully applying machine learning to real-world problems
- Exceptional problem solving skills
- Strong mathematical skills with knowledge of statistical methods
- Excellent software engineering skills in languages such as Scala, Java, Python, C++ or C#
- Great interpersonal skills
- Strong written and verbal communication skills 

Preferred, but not required:
- Experience as a technical leader
- Experience working with cross functional teams
- Experience in Search, Recommendations, Natural Language Processing, Knowledge Graphs, Conversational Agents, and Personalization, etc
- Experience using Deep Learning, Bandits, Probabilistic Graphical Models, or Reinforcement Learning in real world applications
- Experience with Spark, TensorFlow, Keras, and PyTorch
- Experience with cloud computing platforms and large web-scale distributed systems
- Experience in applied research in industrial settings
- Open source contributions
- Research publications at peer reviewed journals and conferences on relevant topics

descriptionPlain:
Netflix is changing the way more than 223+ million subscribers around the world enjoy entertainment. As a company, we challenge industry norms by challenging one another to think creatively about challenging problems. Our content legal team is no exception. We think critically about the range of legal issues that face our productions. We act in a manner consistent with our business culture of freedom and responsibility, one marked by a bias toward action, leaning into smart risks, and taking ownership of bold decisions.  
 
 
The Opportunity: 
 
This is an opportunity to be part of a global entertainment company with a great consumer brand and to help Netflix shape the future of television. The legal team at Netflix is focused on collaborating with its business partners to help foster innovation. 
 
The successful candidate will lead our Business Legal and Affairs team that looks after our Live-action Content productions. Along with leading the team, the candidate will also work on deals themselves including structuring, negotiating and drafting agreements necessary to commission, develop and produce local content with local partners, license content from producers, studios, networks and distributors. The candidate should be extremely comfortable counseling business partners and making decisions that have both legal and business impacts. Furthermore, the candidate will counsel and advise business partners on a wide range of legal issues that arise from the creation, streaming and marketing of our content. 
 
The successful candidate will know and be passionate about learning, the entertainment and media industry generally, and the production of film and television content more precisely. They will understand, or have the ability to learn and manage, the nuanced dynamics among showrunners, executive producers, line producers, finance, post-production, marketing and creative, and how to align the appropriate teams when legal issues arise. 
 
The position will be based in Tokyo.

This is your chance to be at the forefront of Netflix’s new offering of Video Games. We will bring these new experiences to market through the world's leading streaming entertainment app with 221 million paid memberships in over 190 countries who are already enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. 
 
Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and now they can download and play mobile games anytime, anywhere with a collection of Netflix curated and produced Games. At Netflix, we have an insatiable need to continually improve our product experience and the creative elements that support it and this team sits at the forefront of the effort. 
  
To support our gaming efforts, we are seeking a highly effective finance leader to be a trusted business partner to the Gaming team. This position will play a key role in working with senior business leaders in defining and managing both the short-term and long-term vision of this business. This individual should be self-motivated, have a strong passion for financial planning, and thrive in a fast-paced, high-volume, high-impact environment. 
 
This role will sit in our Los Angeles offices and report to the Director, Gaming Strategy, Planning & Analysis.

• Work with cross-functional teams to build the foundational financial framework for the Gaming team

lists.content:
• Build and implement new, scalable workflows for both promotional and non-promotional licensing out of clips/stills from Netflix’s growing content and asset libraries.
  • Establish and own strategic roadmap for the new initiative, prioritizing most impactful areas to the business.
  • Proactively identify workflow/operational pain-points and opportunities; spearhead and socialize innovation and continuous improvements.
  • Liaise with broad set of cross-functional partners like Business & Legal Affairs, Content, PR, Marketing, Operations, Knowledge Management, Rights Management, Finance and others on i) identifying/prioritizing clip/still licensing opportunities and workflows ii) implementing solutions and iii) processing requests efficiently and effectively.
  • Create, socialize and implement rate cards, license terms, and policies for clip and still licensing.

• Field a high volume of internal and external clip/still licensing requests, partnering with internal teams to negotiate terms, obtain necessary approvals and flow assets to licensees efficiently and effectively.
  • Develop and refine clip/still licensing form agreements to ensure enterprise-wide consistency.
  • Draft and negotiate bespoke license requests as required by the business.
  • Identify and implement automated solutions, leveraging pre-approved assets, forms and rates.
  • Ensure proper license management, upload and tagging into our contracts database.
  • Potentially source, evaluate and oversee vendors as needed to support the strategy and operations of the department.

• Collaborate with the Marketing & IP Legal Operations team to configure systems, business processes, and build reports and dashboards based on business requirements.  
  • Develop insights, including financial insights, from licensing data sets to help inform future strategies.

• Deep clip and still licensing experience in a film entertainment studio, production company, or media agency.  
  • Established relationships and experience working with archival libraries (Getty, Shutterstock, etc.)
  • High level of proficiency building complex databases in Airtable, Google Suite Enterprise.
  • Experience negotiating license-out agreements, setting rate cards, and managing large sets of transactions.  
  • Experience developing, launching and managing complex and sometimes ambiguous projects, with a broad set of stakeholders.
  • Proven track record of successful project management from inception to launch.
  • Substantial experience in the entertainment or related content-creation industry.
  • At least 7 years of related work experience.
  • Fluency with Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Slack, Airtable, rights management databases, and Google Suite.

• High level of organization, detail orientation and ability to time-manage across multiple deadlines
  • Ability to respond positively to change and be receptive to new ideas
  • Ability to work effectively and collaboratively cross-functionally, think practically and be solution-oriented
  • Ability to work across borders with multicultural EQ
  • Advocate for inclusion and diversity 
  • Demonstrated good judgment and strong critical thinking skills
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
  • Ability to work proactively, independently and reliably under tight timeframes in a fast-paced environment

descriptionPlain:
Netflix’s mission is to entertain the world by building the world’s leading streaming platform offering great films and series that push the boundaries of storytelling and delight members of all ages and tastes across the world. As we grow our business and teams, we look for people from a wide range of backgrounds to reflect the diversity of our members across the globe. It takes a diversity of lived experiences, cultures, backgrounds and perspectives to create a truly global entertainment company. While we value diversity within our teams, we also recognize that building an inclusive environment where all employees are expected, respected and reflected is of even greater importance - without inclusion, unlocking the true potential of diversity is impossible. 

At Netflix, all employees have a shared responsibility to build and nurture an inclusive culture - not just one person or team. We believe we must work from the inside out to create a place where top talent from all over the world can do the best work of their lives.

We are focused on delivering world class stories that audiences in South Korea, and around the world, will love. Netflix launched here in 2016, and our business has enjoyed tremendous growth since then - thanks to titles such as Squid Game and Extraordinary Attorney Woo to name a few. 

The Manager, Inclusion Strategy - Korea will operate with local autonomy as you work closely with local HR partners, while keeping highly aligned with regional and global Inclusion and HR strategies. You will be expected to establish yourself as a trusted subject matter expert who: offers local leaders thought-partnership regarding inclusive leadership practices; facilitates the learning and development of employees at all levels; supports the growth of employee resource groups (ERGs) as part of our larger global program; and, designs, implements and evaluates a business-centric, inclusion strategy guided by local nuance that helps drive the team forward in South Korea. 

“Diversity is being asked to the party; inclusion is being asked to dance” - Vernā Myers, Vice President of Global Inclusion Strategy, Netflix.

lists.content:
• Work in close partnership with the country HR leader and regional Inclusion leader to deliver meaningful results that contribute to our overall business driven by the Netflix Seoul Office;
  • Be an active member of a regional and global Inclusion Strategy team by participating in team meetings and initiatives, offering capabilities (e.g. communication, cross-cultural competence, project management, etc.), expertise (e.g. local legal environment pertaining to disability, etc.) and insights from a Korean lens to teams distributed around the world;
  • Be a strategic thought partner who supports both the Netflix Seoul Office and the global Inclusion Strategy team to nurture an inclusive workplace environment, by: Designing, implementing and evaluating an Inclusion strategy for the Netflix Seoul Office that addresses local needs and opportunities; Engaging, facilitating and coaching HR teams and business leaders on concepts and practices that promote workplace inclusion;  Partnering with Talent Management and global Inclusion Strategy teams to apply local nuance when customizing and rolling out our suite of centrally-designed initiatives; Advising cross-functional partners as we work to ensure that recruitment, hiring, development and promotion systems are equitable, especially for employees who come from historically underrepresented groups in the Korean talent market;
  • Develop and support employee resource groups (ERG) intended to address the needs of employees from historically underrepresented groups in the Republic of Korea, while keeping tightly aligned with regional and global ERG strategies;
  • Collaborate with cross-functional partners and external subject matter experts to provide strategic advisory to teams involved in content, production, publicity and other aspects of Netflix’s business;
  • Engage and network with external groups and organizations in the Republic of Korea to keep up to date on local trends and build partnerships that contribute to Netflix’s business goals.

• A passion for improving existing systems and practices - and building new ones;
  • Solid experience implementing inclusive workplace practices (or similar) and managing change within an organization. An industry track record of at least three years would be ideal;
  • Examples of successfully managed projects; 
  • Previous experience designing and implementing complex local, national and/or regional strategies would be an advantage;
  • Some experience giving senior leaders constructive feedback for development purposes and/or coaching leaders on business-centric, inclusive leadership practices that help to unlock the potential of diverse teams;
  • Strong curiosity, communication, influencing and collaboration skills;
  • High proficiency in Korean language is essential - including an ability to communicate complex concepts with clarity - e.g. privilege, unconscious bias, vulnerability and allyship;
  • Deep cultural knowledge about historically underrepresented groups in the Republic of Korea and has skills for improving the equity of an employer’s outreach, hiring, onboarding, development and promotion efforts;
  • Some basic knowledge of labor laws in the Republic of Korea would be an advantage;
  • Ability to collaborate effectively with colleagues/stakeholders who speak English would be an advantage.

descriptionPlain:
At Netflix, we are shaping the future of entertainment and changing the way more than 230 million subscribers around the world enjoy entertainment. Our international efforts have brought Netflix to virtually all countries and we’re excited to bring even more of our programming to our viewers around the globe. It’s an exciting time to work at Netflix.

The Opportunity

With Netflix now a local producer of content across the world, and a third of our members living in EMEA and the UK, our marketing efforts in these regions are intensifying. The Netflix Music team is looking for an experienced manager to support Netflix’s Marketing and PR teams based in the EMEA and UK regions. This role will report to the Director, Music - Business & Legal Affairs - EMEA.

Our Marketing and PR campaigns are a key part of Netflix’s ongoing success, and music is core to those campaigns.  Working closely with the company’s stakeholders in the Marketing and PR organizations and Music Group, the successful candidate will be comfortable advising on a wide range of music matters including music searches, custom music, and music clearance and budgeting while keeping in mind the strategic goals of the company and understanding the broader legal implications of taking one action over another.  They have experience working in the fast-paced world of marketing, advertising, gaming or television promotion and know how to keep things moving while managing stakeholder expectations. In addition they love everything music.  They spend their free time going to venues, searching the Internet for the next great artist, and studying musicology.  They know everyone in the industry - the record labels, publishers, artists, managers, agents, studios, networks, agencies, marketing teams, producers, post producers, editors, and directors.  They think having several different licenses (synch, master, mechanical, etc.) for the same work makes complete sense and don’t think twice about a 7-way split ownership for “a side” of a song.  They understand copyright as it pertains to music and have worked on projects across a variety of countries in Europe, the Middle East Africa and the UK.

The successful candidate will be someone who loves working in a culture where freedom and responsibility are tenets, and passion, innovation and curiosity are mandates.  They will have incredible soft skills to complement their diligent work ethic.  They seek an environment that places thoughtful efficiency over process yet they know how to work with organizations or institutions that may not hold the same beliefs.

lists.content:
• Coordinating with Netflix’s internal cross-functional stakeholders as well as outside parties including labels, publishers, copyright owners, composers, their managers and/or attorneys, regarding clearance, ownership, and financial procedures and license fees.
  • Align with their Music Services counterparts across the globe in order to maintain a cohesive and thoughtful global music strategy.
  • Helping source music and contribute music ideas for given creative briefs, as  required. Manage the expectations of the Marketing Creatives as they develop their campaigns.
  • Execute stakeholder music ideas with a flexible way of thinking and an innovative  application of music licensing principles
  • Clearly and simply convey music concepts to non-music experts on the fly, and pro-actively through internal educational efforts.
  • Researching music ownership and seeking/obtaining quotes from labels and publishers.
  • Managing, negotiating, and preparing/reviewing licenses (master and synch, etc.).
  • Negotiating and executing custom music projects with music houses, artists, and producers.
  • Building and maintaining strong relationships with third-party companies, labels, artists, studios, publishers, producers, various guilds and music/performance associations (e.g. SACEM, STEMRA, GEMA, BMU etc).
  • Meeting with current and new music production houses, libraries, songwriters and producers and making recommendations for future opportunities.
  • Managing Netflix marketing and PR’s music clearance needs and rights management, including tracking territory, media and terms and maintaining all cue sheets.
  • Obtaining media buy schedules in order to pay talent fees, if necessary, for all spots and to provide to publisher’s/labels as required by licenses.
  • Following industry trends for new business/content opportunities.
  • Participating in other projects specific to Netflix’s marketing music needs.

• The ideal candidate will bring 5-10+ years of direct music clearance experience at a major production, film/television studio, television network, agency, publisher, label, video game company, social media company or music department.
  • The candidate will be expected to stay closely aligned with the Music Services team in the U.S.
  • Excellence in an autonomous work environment with a vision to spot broad issues and create solutions with an attitude humble enough to dive into the day to day work.
  • Fluency with technology and experience using data analyzation as a tool to inform strategic choices and solve problems.
  • Clear, concise communication skills.
  • Adaptable to the communication and negotiation nuances pertaining to diverse markets and cultures.
  • Highly-collaborative, with the ability to be fluid and respond positively to change and new ideas.
  • Ability to work proactively, independently and reliably on multiple projects under tight timeframes in a fast-paced production environment.
  • Ability to pivot quickly, think practically, and be solution-oriented.
  • Curiosity and eagerness to tackle additional projects as needed, including matters outside of your area of expertise
  • Fluent in English and at least one other language relevant to the territory is highly preferred
  • Willingness and enthusiasm to travel to EMEA and the U.S based on the needs of the business.
  • A commitment to embrace and advocate for inclusion is essential

descriptionPlain:
With 223m+ paid memberships in over 190 countries, Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service and is powered by a work culture that’s focused on high performance and continuous improvement. This is a great opportunity to join our Australian office to create local conversation and impact with key strategic partners as we continue to aggressively grow our slate of local and global original, exclusive content.

We’re looking for an innovative, self-starter to fill the role of Manager, Marketing Partnerships - Australia + New Zealand who will be responsible for managing local relationships with strategic partners that we can partner with to co-create and execute marketing campaigns that maximize the impact of our content, product and brand in Australia and New Zealand. 

We’re looking for someone who can build a strategic approach to a rich mix of partners - ranging from those that increase acquisition (ISPs, telcos, pay-TV partners) to those who can support retention by generating conversation and brand relevance (consumer/culture brands). 

From global blockbusters like Bridgerton, Stranger Things and Squid Game to our slate of distinctive, local Netflix originals like Heartbreak High and Boy Swallows Universe, this is an opportunity to work on the most conversational series and film titles in the world.  

Our ideal candidate is a seasoned professional who can build an overarching strategy, ruthlessly prioritise a range of existing/growing relationships, develop creative thought-starters, negotiate media plans, and manage the full life cycle of content partner marketing projects to fully weave Netflix into local culture.
We highly encourage reading the Who We Are section of the Netflix website and learning about the Netflix Culture to ensure that all candidates feel that Netflix is a good fit.

descriptionPlain:
Netflix is the world’s leading streaming entertainment service with 220 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Having launched in Korea in 2016, Netflix evolved from being a relatively unknown company in a brand new segment to becoming a successful mainstream player in entertainment and pop culture in the country. Globally and locally, our growth came in the wake of a sustained commitment to satisfying consumers, combining a great product experience with an ever-growing library of exclusive series and movies. 

The Opportunity 

It's an exciting time to join Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment globally. We are bringing new stories to millions of people worldwide by promoting our original, exclusive content. A key to growth is our ability to work well with strategic partners across verticals. As we move beyond 220 million members and hundreds of partnerships worldwide, we are looking for talented individuals to drive better creative outcomes for our marketing partnerships in Korea.

We are seeking a Partner Creative Manager who will help us grow our business with our partners in Korea. This individual will be responsible for developing our partner campaign positioning and strategy and will manage the crafting and execution of marketing campaigns that inspire people to share and talk about Netflix and our content, ultimately inspiring sign-ups to watch. This person should value entrepreneurial work environments and thrive in our ‘freedom and responsibility' culture

We work with a growing range of partners in Korea such as 1) acquisition partners (ISPs, mobile carriers, MVPDs), 2) Device partners, 3) Brand/consumer product partners. The ideal candidate will have deep experience in building effective creative and smart campaigns that drive business objectives and build consumer love for a brand.

As a partner-facing strategist, creative and gatekeeper of the Netflix brand, this individual will be responsible for the day-to-day communication with our partners as it relates to creative work. You’ll work closely with the Partner Marketing Manager to pitch and shape partner campaigns and programs. You will also work collaboratively with partners and agencies, as well as cross-functionally with internal creative teams to deliver best-in-class creative executions. 

If you are passionate about entertainment and building cultural brands, with demonstrated experience in crafting and executing impactful creative campaigns/programmes, we’d love to hear from you.

The mission of the Production Strategy and Operations (PS&O) team is to empower Netflix to achieve its operational goals and creative pursuits through production solutions, technology, resource assurance, and workflow optimization. 

The PS&O team is looking for an execution-oriented, highly effective senior leader with extensive knowledge of live-action production workflows, tools, and platforms, including the awareness of trends driving the media industry transformation. This unique and exciting opportunity will directly impact the future of production and operationalizing bleeding edge technology, such as next-generation workflows to our post facilities and content creators around the world.

As a proven leader, you have solid business sense and sound judgment, with first-hand experience rolling out new technologies and workflows in collaboration with operational and technical teams across different domains and time zones. You will be responsible for building strong connections with title-facing teams, ensuring a tight product feedback loop, and coordinating smooth, high-quality feature launches. 

Your role includes components of strategy, operations, and communications. Although you’re a big picture thinker with a strategic purview, you’re not afraid of rolling up your sleeves and operating at a tactical level to get the job done. As such, you understand the urgent needs of production today as you oversee the operationalization of innovative long-term solutions of tomorrow.

  • Strong organizational skills with a proactive mentality, positive orientation, and outlook

  • Team player who thrives in a fast-paced, team-oriented setting
  • Ability to handle a heavy volume of work, supervising several projects at various points of production (from development through delivery)

• Develop country level long-term studio strategies, facilities and resource plans and support the execution of those deals
  • Lead the analysis and valuation of new deals in partnership with the production management, post production, VFX, and other key studio divisions to facilitate decision making and timely execution
  • Conduct ongoing analysis of key business drivers, trends and performance indicators
  • Regularly present analyses and reports on relevant operating and financial metrics in an easy-to-understand format to senior business leaders
  • Develop a deep understanding of industry trends as well as competitive threats and opportunities
  • Oversee Studio Financial Planning & Analysis, including near-term and long-term P&L, cash, and resource planning forecasts for APAC Production teams
  • Develop strong relationships and partner cross-functionally with Strategy, Finance, and Data Science & Engineering teams
  • We are looking for a manager who can grow with us over time with the ability to scale team resources and manage associate(s): establish priorities, set objectives, and provide guidance and feedback

• Candidates are required to be highly analytical and be strong, effective communicators. Candidates must be excellent at crafting, presenting, and socializing complex ideas, recommendations, and insights to broad stakeholder groups. 
  • The successful candidate must display, through attitude and accomplishments, a strong initiative for anticipating and meeting the business demands of senior-level business managers. This person must be a solutions oriented problem solver with a focus on generating impact.
  • This person must thrive in a fast-paced environment, possess a high level of intellectual curiosity, focus on generating results and exhibit the highest personal and professional standards of integrity and ethics.
  • Netflix is fast-growing with a flat organizational structure, which means that employees are often asked to perform tasks with a range of difficulties. The ideal candidate would be prepared to regularly "roll up their sleeves" to perform more routine tasks on the same day that they are asked to prepare analysis and a presentation to the executives of the company. The successful candidate must be motivated, disciplined and be able to work effectively autonomously.

• Ideal candidates will have 7+ years of experience or MBA and a proven track record of superior financial modeling, data analysis, and strategic planning, including prior experience in consulting, finance, and/or strategy-related roles.
  • Ideally at least a year of experience in TV or film production or adjacent finance- or strategy-related roles, especially those focused on leading operational and supply chain improvement.
  • A commitment to embrace and advocate for inclusion is essential, including demonstrated cross-cultural understanding and intelligence.
  • Fluent in English, High Proficiency Japanese or Korean (depending on location)

This is a demanding and fast moving position that requires a proactive and positive thinker who is able to exercise good judgment, effective communication, and initiative.

lists.content:
• - Production oversight and innovation- :
  • Provide insight into UK production workflows and how they impact the transportation department.
  • Partner with Production Executives in the supervision and management of Transportation Department 
  • Oversee and provide support to our production transportation crews in the areas of employee relations, Company policies, and operational alignment.
  • Collaborate with and mediate between our internal cross-functional departments (specifically Human Resources, Safety, Risk Management, Finance, Sustainability, and Legal) and external physical production management relating to studio transportation policies, requirements and issues.
  • Participate in exploring, testing, and piloting new programs and technologies to see how they will affect our industry in an effort to meet our carbon reduction goals
  • Provide recommendations for improvement that may have regional implications to the organization.
  • Partner with Assets and Archives to ensure action vehicles are properly registered and tracked.
  • Advise internal and external production teams on regulatory issues and collaborate with applicable cross-functional partners to find solutions.
  • Maintain a current understanding of the evolving landscape of transportation regulations across multiple geographies and regions.

  • - Regional Lead- :
  • Acts as Regional Manager of Studio Transportation
  • Collaborate with Transportation Manager on building training programs, as needed, and creating infrastructure for UK productions
  • Maintain and update transportation manuals and workflow docs.
  • Study, understand and apply appropriate global regulations, contracts, and workflows to both inform regional policies and create a knowledge base for efficiencies that can be shared cross-regionally.
  • Partner with Safety Team to establish working Protocols for Transportation Crews
  • Align with departmental and Company deliverables, strategies and philosophies.
  • Develop and curate a catalogue of regional vendors (with a focus on sustainability and underserved business communities).  Liaise with these vendors to enhance relationships and formulate mutual goals.
  • Process, review and apply data analytics to contribute to strategic decisions and inform and validate operational innovations.
  • Establish innovate way to secure, sell, store, and track action vehicles in region

• Physical production experience in UK/EMEA film or television is required.
  • A minimum of five (5) years of experience working in the Entertainment transportation industry. 
  • BA/BS Degree or equivalent experience
  • Experience leading and representing a team to internal cross-functional partners, and external production stakeholders in the UK, EMEA - additional regions a plus
  • A working knowledge of the types and uses of production transportation equipment.
  • The ability to prioritize and respond to urgent issues in a fast paced environment while simultaneously supervising multiple productions.
  • An entrepreneurial mindset in resolving business problems, which includes responding to time-sensitive and/or urgent matters after hours.
  • Proficient in the application and communication of basic data analysis to identify trends and enhance our understanding of transportation related concerns. 
  • Willingness to continue learning, be flexible and pivot to drive workflows as the department and business grows
  • Team player who operates in a fast-paced team oriented setting
  • The ability to manage and secure confidential information, and the discretion to employ appropriate control measures to protect privacy.
  • A passion for continued education and innovation in the transportation space including both regulatory and sustainable learnings.
  • Travel between studios, productions and storage required
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills.
  • Strong project management background
  • A curious mind with an emphasis on technology and a passion for innovation.

• You have a proven track record of building impactful, world-class creative campaigns that connect with audiences and break through the cultural zeitgeist. We are not only building campaigns, we are transforming our properties into culturally relevant brands.
  • You are a natural team leader with an ability to build strategic foundations, conceptualize campaign approaches and articulate creative ideas that people rally around.
  • You are a cross-functional partner who is able to engage, listen and collaborate with internal departments/teams to align early on in terms of overall strategy and goals, and to see the cross-functional collaboration through launch. 
  • You are an effective team leader and manager in a fast paced, multifaceted environment. Your team will have multiple launch campaigns happening at once. 
  • You are passionate and curious about all aspects of marketing + innovation, and  strive to create impactful and effective visual storytelling across all mediums and platforms. 
  • You have a passion for a range of Animated content, casual experience with gaming and have deep knowledge of the entertainment landscape and media trends globally.
  • You have exposure to working on global campaigns, with reach domestically and internationally. Ideally, you have a global IQ and/or are familiar with working with teams from different regional markets.
  • You are a connoisseur of creative marketing (trailers, key art, digital/social media) and have solid experience developing strategic insights to inform 360 creative marketing campaigns. 
  • You have a deep knowledge of the social media landscape, including a strong understanding not only of their features and technology, but of the new consumer behaviors emerging everyday. Specifically, understanding of how to leverage platforms like YouTube, Tiktok, Discord, Reddit or social gaming experiences like Roblox  to reach kids or adult audiences. 
  • You are passionate and curious about all aspects of marketing, and  strive to create effective visual storytelling across all platforms (mobile, paid and organic social, broadcast, out-of-home and all other mediums/platforms.)
  • You have experience creating impactful, out-of-the-box social media strategies that nurture and encourage fandom and leverage the social space in new and unexpected ways. 
  • You have a good understanding of marketing, social and media analytics and how to apply data to test and optimize campaigns.
  • You appreciate technology and can collaborate with our world class product team to integrate our multi-title campaigns within the member product experience. 
  • You have an entrepreneurial mindset and are eager to flourish in our unique company culture(see Who We Are).

• Build our upcoming Animation Series launch campaigns -- from strategy development to creative execution through to production, and how to sustain engagement beyond launch windows.
  • Leader of creative innovation for the animated audience and the content slate, managing single title campaigns and broader brand efforts where animated titles are featured.  
  • Key contact amongst all cross functional teams including content, consumer products, regional marketing, publicity, communications, creative marketing production, product, and editorial to optimize across team and ensure goals are being met. 
  • Maintain close partnership with our consumer products team to ensure cohesive brand development across title campaigns. 
  • Project management of campaign cross-functional initiatives including (but not limited to) leading, organizing, mobilizing and planning internal task force meetings and brainstorm sessions and external filmmaker kickoffs/presentations.
  • Write creative briefs to guide the creative process and align internal marketing teams on goals and overall strategies. 
  • Provide high level filmmaker / talent management and support across the slate. 
  • Participate in and/or lead lively debates and discussions as you communicate different facets of the campaign to filmmakers, talent and colleagues across the company. 
  • Collaborate with our world class product/engineering team to integrate our originals marketing campaigns within the member product experience. 
  • Demonstrate mastery of verbal and written communication skills and presentation skills, as you will lead meetings and manage workflow with many internal and external stakeholders/partners.

• 7+ years of experience in building strategic and creative consumer marketing campaigns, preferably at a streaming network or studio with a background in animated entertainment (TV, film, gaming), global brand or creative/advertising agency. 
  • A history of managing and leading in a fast paced and relationship focused environment.
  • Experience managing a high volume of campaign types in parallel, while collaborating with diverse, geographically-dispersed teams. 
  • Native understanding of digital advertising (direct video, mobile, paid social, display, rich media, VOD) with strong grasp on Youtube, Tiktok, Discord and how best to leverage the platform for our marketing needs.
  • Strong interpersonal, creative, presentation, problem solving, negotiating, influencing, facilitation, organizational, prioritization, decision making, analytical and conflict resolution skills.
  • Passion for and experience working with animated content (3D, 2D, Stop Motion, Hybrid, etc) is a must.

descriptionPlain:
Netflix is one of the world’s leading entertainment services with 231 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. 

Overview
At Netflix, Marketing’s core purpose is to maximize the impact of our content, product and brand so that everyone, everywhere wants to watch Netflix. Marketing Planning - Exports helps achieve that purpose by ensuring that the content and campaigns originated in Latin America reach and resonate with audiences globally in the most efficient and impactful way.

LATAM Marketing Planning Managers, specialized in exports,  work alongside Marketing and PR in the region to develop truly global campaigns for the titles originated and produced in Latin America. They are responsible for not only collaborating with cross-functional teams within the region, but also working closely with partners from other regions- to understand local nuances, business objectives and marketing opportunities and bringing that perspective back to the country of origin to ensure campaigns are developed to create impact outside of the home territory.

A primary goal for the team is to work in a strategic planning capacity to help analyze the exportable content and assess global viability in an effort to help identify and prioritize our biggest title bets and align our resources to maximize the value of our content around the world. 

Within a title’s lifecycle, Marketing Planning - Exports acts as the connective tissue in the critical campaign planning, development and launch phases, creating operational efficiencies, driving global cross-functional collaboration and ensuring strategic alignment for effective campaign execution.

descriptionPlain:
Come play a pivotal role in Netflix's quest to transform the way a studio empowers and accelerates production workflows, making the Movie Labs 2030 vision a reality.  This is an exciting opportunity for anyone that is passionate about production and post workflows and ready to take the filmmaking process to the next level.

The PS&O (Production Strategy & Operations) team is looking for an execution-oriented, highly effective workflow engineer with extensive knowledge in content production workflows, tools, and platforms, including a proven history of providing white glove support to post-production.  This unique and exciting opportunity will have a direct impact on the future of production supporting bleeding-edge technology, such as next-generation workflows to our post facilities and content creators around the world.

With a proven background in the production/post landscape, you have the ability to understand complex workflows from on-set through post-production and can communicate with filmmakers, understanding various production-specific roles and departments and how they work together.  Aside from an extensive workflow background, you also have a post-engineering background.  The Media Production Suite (MPS) Support Specialist will essentially be an air traffic controller for post-production automated tools we offer at Netflix.  This role will be responsible for monitoring all pipelines, flagging and resolving issues, and ensuring communication internally and externally is managed for any issues that arise.  Therefore the right candidate will understand production and post-production workflow, as well as the sensitivity and timeliness of production needs, but also be able to get under the hood of our tools and troubleshoot when a service is having issues. A ‘Geek With Swagger’ if you will.  Someone that is very technical with an engineering background, but also has a proven track record of being trusted to communicate directly with clients.

Your role will include collaborating with the studio, product, engineering, Netflix personnel, and crew directly working on productions. Therefore you will need the ability to manage expectations, multi-task, and make judgment calls on when to elevate which issues to which team.

descriptionPlain:
Come play a pivotal role in Netflix's quest to transform the way a studio empowers and accelerates production workflows, making the Movie Labs 2030 vision a reality.  This is an exciting opportunity for anyone that is passionate about production and post workflows and ready to take the filmmaking process to the next level.

The PS&O (Production Strategy & Operations) team is looking for an execution-oriented, highly effective workflow engineer with extensive knowledge in live-action production workflows, tools and platforms, including a proven history in providing white glove support to post production.  This unique and exciting opportunity will have a direct impact on the future of production supporting bleeding edge technology, such as next generation workflows to our post facilities and content creators around the world.

With a proven background in the production/post landscape, you have the ability to understand complex workflows from on set through post production and can communicate with filmmakers, understanding various production specific roles and departments and how they work together.  Aside from an extensive workflow background, you also have a post engineering background.  The Media Production Suite (MPS) Support Specialist will essentially be an air traffic controller for post production automated tools we offer at Netflix.  This role will be responsible for monitoring all pipelines, flagging and resolving issues, and ensuring communication internally and externally is managed for any issues that arise.  Therefore the right candidate will understand production and post production workflow, as well as the sensitivity and timeliness of production needs, but also be able to get under the hood of our tools and troubleshoot when a service is having issues. A ‘Geek With Swagger’ if you will.  Someone that is very technical with an engineering background, but also has a proven track record being trusted to communicate directly with clients.

Your role will include collaborating with studio, product, engineering, Netflix personnel and crew directly working on productions. Therefore you will need the ability to manage expectations, multi-task and make judgment calls on when to elevate which issues to which team.

lists.text: How do you know if this role is right for you?
lists.content:
• You have managed engineering at a post production facility, or have a background in software/hardware development & you have worked on set, or in post production or,
  • You have managed an automated transcoding service in a past job offered to post production

• Monitor all Media Production Suite (MPS) automated transcoding activity 
  • Ensure the Netflix Media production Suite tools receive timely support when issues arise
  • Manage the triage & escalation paths for any pipeline issues through to completion
  • Ensure all issues flagged, that had work arounds offered to un-stick production, get elevated to Product for prioritization.

lists.text: Specific responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
lists.content:
• Partner closely with the Manager, Production Technology Solutions & Manager, Production Operations Strategy to stay current on product developments. This includes tracking key milestones and timelines to ensure awareness of product version management.
  • Act as the primary point-of-contact for production and vendors in resolving escalated MPS related issues, or to answer MPS related questions.
  • Serve as the escalation point for MPS challenges encountered by Netflix colleagues in their region.
  • Identify and correct complex workflow issues with users.
  • Diagnose and rapidly escalate tooling issues to support and engineering teams, partnering with them until the issue is resolved.
  • Escalate notable tooling issues to the Manager of Production Operations Strategy and Manager of Production Technology Solutions and aid in prioritization in continued development.
  • Monitor and analyze MPS utilization to proactively identify potential issues, and inform forecasting and future resource management.
  • Partner with other MPS Solution Specialists around the world to provide off-hours coverage for other regions.
  • Partner with the Manager of Production Operations Strategy on advancing and evolving MPS operational strategy.
  • Liaise with the Post Services team, supporting MPS tools/pipelines for Netflix titles that utilize Netflix facilities.
  • Own the feedback loop for MPS from their region to PS&O and Product.

• A post-production professional with a multi-faceted background in technology and support is ideal
  • Adaptability and willingness to change
  • Ability to understand changing global production landscape, and competitive markets

• 3+ years of experience in Post production, with roles in facility, as well as process management, at a post production vendor, studio or network.
  • Deep knowledge and experience with content creation processes, on set production and post production services.
  • 2+ years experience in a support role for a product offered to post production or production users
  • Understanding of JSON
  • Understand the practical application of and have experience in dailies processing, editorial, VFX pulls, conform/online to final delivery. 
  • Familiarity with production and post production software (e.g. Avid Media Composer, Adobe Premiere, Colorfront OSD & Transkoder).
  • Strong communication skills with proven ability to articulate to both stakeholders and end users, issues currently facing productions.
  • Proven ability to manage expectations and remain calm under pressure.
  • A clear understanding for how software from on set through production and post are used and the differentiators between them.
  • Experience working with diverse teams across multiple functions, skills and locations
  • Strong organizational skills with proactive mentality, positive orientation and outlook
  • Ability to respond after hours for important, timely, or urgent matters
  • Team-player who thrives in a fast paced, team-oriented setting
  • Knowledge of industry standards and the bodies that ratify them.
  • Knowledge of and relationships with technology solutions, equipment and service vendors across production and post production.
  • Must be fluent in verbal and written communication skills in English including the ability to cultivate internal and external relationships.
  • Fluency in Japanese, Korean, and English
  • Passionate about our culture and values in the workplace

descriptionPlain:
Netflix is the world's leading internet entertainment service with over 220 million members in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, feature films, and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. At Netflix, the Editorial Insights team brings context to content - classifying it, describing it, and capturing its essence - to help connect our members to the content they’ll love.

As part of Editorial Insights, Metadata Development’s mission is to expand the possibilities of how editorial metadata and insights can be used to help our members and the business make better sense of the world of entertainment. Our work is meant to be pioneering, experimental and boundary-pushing; rooted in the power of bringing together a human understanding of content, storytelling and audiences with scalable technology solutions. 

As a Metadata Technologist focused on algorithmic solutions, you will be responsible for developing, piloting and implementing new concepts and approaches that bring deeper context to Netflix content from pitch to play. This covers the full spectrum of new metadata development, from ideation with key stakeholders to business-case development, to advocacy, buy-in, testing, and full productization across team verticals. This role will report to the Manager of Metadata Development and is remote-friendly.

  • Partner with Engineering, Operations, Product Management, Program Management and Planning & Analysis teams to scope and develop the tool, workflow and resource implications and possibilities of new concepts and approaches.

  • Experience managing projects across the development and implementation lifecycle within highly cross-functional, non-hierarchical or matrixed workplaces. 
  • Incredible passion for storytelling with a deep knowledge of the worlds of television, movies, gaming and entertainment.
  • Comfortable in “left brain” (logical) and “right brain” (creative) problem solving, understanding how to leverage data and insights to drive value and impact.

Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with over 220 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen.

The Open Connect Capacity Planning team is at the center of all efforts to ensure that there’s always enough capacity so that our members always have a great entertainment experience. Working with the engineering and finance teams, Capacity Planning main tasks include: 1) translating demand forecasts into concise, actionable capacity plans, 2) managing utilization by providing reports and dashboards out to key stakeholders, and 3) provide data-driven analyses to continually optimize spend and ensure the platform is scalable far into the future.

The Open Connect Capacity Planning group is recruiting for a Network Capacity Planner to focus on hardware and IP backbone capacity planning.

descriptionPlain:
About Netflix
Netflix is the world's leading internet entertainment service with over 200 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments.

Netflix continues to revolutionize the way content is created and delivered to millions of users all across the globe while always striving to maintain a world-class user-experience. 

The Opportunity
Our mission is to revolutionize the way on service (Product) creative is made and delivered, fueling new ways for Netflix members to discover new titles. The Creative Planning team is a driving force in establishing how we ask for creative, how we find and prime the best creative partners around the globe, and how we streamline production. Made up of a diverse team of creative industry professionals, this team is reinventing the future of Netflix product creative strategy and operations, and specific to this role, the partners and systems that drive our ability to scale the business across the globe. 

We are looking for a Partner Manager to join our global team. In this role, you will help unlock the full potential of our creative partnerships including, but not limited to, creative agencies and creative freelancers, who concept and develop creative to promote Netflix titles. You will curate, cultivate and optimize creative partnerships grounded in performance insights in order to maximize business value. 

This role requires creative operational know-how to translate creative ideas into effective partnership selection and enablement strategies. The right candidate knows how to drive partner performance improvements to produce optimal creative outcomes. This candidate has pre-existing relationships with top creatives and is able to work with a variety of creative partners to continually raise the bar.

The Team You’ll be Joining: Photo & AV Studio 
The Photo & AV Studio team has the enviable position of straddling two worlds in the entertainment industry: Photo & AV asset creation & global communication strategy. We specialize in capturing and creating photo & video assets that shape, enhance and support our publicity campaigns for our Netflix content including Series, Films, and Documentaries. 
Simply put, we produce content that compels people to watch our shows through various media.

The Role

What photos will pop up on Socials? What videos will drive conversation through socials? What videos will help influencers to create their own assets? What photos will ensure a magazine spread? What video will get audiences and publishers excited about a new show? How can we help influencers to create assets? How do we make a talking head interview visually pop? How can we be smart and tell different stories across different countries through visual assets? These are just some of the opportunities you’ll be delivering in this role.

We are seeking a strategic individual to support PR campaigns, driven by A/V materials, for Netflix titles - photography, videos, audio, animation, graphic design.. the next big thing. Our content stands out and makes an impact on the industry and consumers alike, compelling them to watch Netflix content. 

The role requires a high level of creativity, an inquisitive, innovative and self-motivated personality, and a succinct communicator. Being a team player with a positive attitude and willingness to be flexible and get the job done is essential, as is the ability to strategically plan and execute multiple projects simultaneously.  

You’ll be working with TV/film productions, talent, filmmakers and publicity events as part of the Netflix PR team. Building relationships as well as working autonomously in a fast-paced environment will be key to success.
 
We don’t focus on job titles at Netflix but hire outstanding high performers who act responsibly on the resources and freedom they are given to do their work. The ideal candidate will use sound judgment to make wise decisions, think strategically and drive their colleagues to do the same. Read our culture memo to learn more. 

This job is based in Paris and reports to the Photo & AV Studio Manager.

We’re looking for an ambitious and savvy self-starter - ideally with a background in media and/or entertainment - who has a passion for film, television and/or games to join our DACH PR team. Based in Berlin, you will report to the PR Director, DACH.

You will also have a deep understanding of issues and crisis management and will have worked alongside and managed agencies on projects.
 
You are able to remain calm under pressure, make wise decisions and think strategically at all times while having a hands-on mentality. You will collaborate well with internal partners from content, publicity, public policy, marketing, engineering, product and more.

Our Team

The Ads Platform Engineering team builds the advertising systems and integrations that powers the delivery of ads using our world class content delivery ecosystem. We use a number of Netflix investments and innovations to power our ads - unique mix of client and server side ad insertions, state of the art content delivery system, ad encoding recipes, content understanding and metadata etc. We deliver ads in a manner that’s thoughtful of our member’s viewing experience and drive great outcomes for advertisers. We also ensure that advertiser brand safety is ensured during serving, members only see the most appropriate ads for them.

Our team is new and yet faced with the enormous ambitions of building highly performant advertising systems and delivering high impact to our business by monetizing our incredible slate of content. As one of the newest entrants in the Connected TV advertising space that’s rapidly growing, we seek to build unique value propositions that help us differentiate from the competition and become a market leader in record time.

We are looking for a thought leader in the advertising space who is excited to join us on this journey.

Our Team

The Ads Platform Engineering team builds the advertising systems and integrations that powers the delivery of ads using our world class content delivery ecosystem. We use a number of Netflix investments and innovations to power our ads - unique mix of client and server side ad insertions, state of the art content delivery system, ad encoding recipes, content understanding and metadata etc. We deliver ads in a manner that’s thoughtful of our member’s viewing experience and drive great outcomes for advertisers. We also ensure that advertiser brand safety is ensured during serving, members only see the most appropriate ads for them.

Our team is new and yet faced with the enormous ambitions of building highly performant advertising systems and delivering high impact to our business by monetizing our incredible slate of content. As one of the newest entrants in the Connected TV advertising space that’s rapidly growing, we seek to build unique value propositions that help us differentiate from the competition and become a market leader in record time.

We are looking for a thought leader in the advertising space who is excited to join us on this journey.

descriptionPlain:
Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with 222 million members in over 190 countries enjoying TV, Films, and Games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen.  

The Opportunity
The Creative Production team is collectively responsible for the launch and representation of content on Netflix - including localization of the Netflix experience and content, synopses, metadata, ratings, and creative assets. Nested within Creative Production, the Product Creative Studio team’s purpose is to create the most compelling discovery experience through artwork and video to connect our millions of global subscribers to the content they love. The team partners with games developers and our internal games studio to define how their games are creatively represented on Netflix and on the iOS App Store and Android App Store, working closely with internal creative teams and external agencies to develop promotional creative campaigns dedicated to helping members choose a great title to watch. This role will contribute to new areas of creative exploration for games representation.

The Role
You will lead a distributed team of creative strategists, producers, designers, and video editors who drive the acquisition and development of all creative elements for both acquired games and original games on our service and App Stores. You’ll create strong partnerships and collaborate across Games Operations, Games Studio, and Product to bring our subscribers a unique and unparalleled games experience. 
 
You will also be a key stakeholder in the broader global Product Creative team. Responsible for sharing learnings and contributing to a culture of creative excellence on a larger scale. 

We consider ourselves to be advocates for our 200M+ members, Netflix Games are a new addition to our catalog. We work to educate, optimize and connect our members' subscribers to games they will love. The team is focused on reducing friction, increasing joy, and driving engagement through authentic and compelling campaigns and representation of our content catalog. 

We have an opportunity to disrupt the traditional landscape. 

We are champions for testing, innovation, and productized experiences across all Netflix platforms.

This is a challenging role that requires the ability to work across several disciplines and relationship channels to bring together top-level creative and research-driven design thinking. Including being successful in a matrixed organization. 


The Right Stuff
You have a proven track record of building and leading teams that excel both creatively and strategically to create great work.  You are able to build relationships with colleagues in high-level leadership roles - positioning yourself and your team as a valued partner in meeting company objectives.  You are passionate about games and shaping the future of the Netflix Games offering, guiding strategy, and setting principles while collaborating with others to launch meaningful experiences and launch awesome games. You thrive in a fast-paced, ever-shifting, high-volume, high-impact environment.  You are entrepreneurial and self-motivated, and embody Netflix’s culture of high performance, curiosity, freedom, and responsibility.
